# Wiki Syntax Guide
___
## Complete Syntax Reference
> Below is every formatting option supported by this wiki.
___
| **Feature** | **Syntax (Remove Spaces)** | **Description** |
|---|---|---|
| **BOLD** | `**Text**` | Wrap text in double asterisks. |
| **ITALIC** | `*Text*` | Wrap text in single asterisks. |
| **STRIKE** | `~~Text~~` | Wrap text in double tildes. |
| **CODE** | `Text` | Wrap text in backticks. |
| **HEADER** | `# Title` | Use 1 to 6 hashtags. Must be at start of line. |
| **LIST** | `* Item` | Use an asterisk. Must be at start of line. |
| **QUOTE** | `> Text` | Use a greater-than sign. Must be at start of line. |
| **DIVIDER** | `___` | Three underscores create a line. |
| **LINK (Web)** | `[Name](https://url.com)` | Standard web link. |
| **LINK (Wiki)** | `[[PageName]]` | Links to another Wiki Node. |
| **LINK (Named)**| `[Link to Home](wiki:Home) ` | Links to a Node with custom text. |
| **IMG (Full)** | `[img] URL` | Full size image. |
| **IMG (Icon)** | `[imgi] URL` | **Icon Size:** Resizes to 32px width. |
| **IMG (Small)** | `[imgs] URL` | **Small:** Resizes to 25% width. |
| **IMG (Med)** | `[imgm] URL` | **Medium:** Resizes to 50% width. |
___

## How to Create Tables
To create a table, wrap your text in pipes `|`.
1. The **First Row** is always the Header (Dark background, Red text).
2. The **Second Row** is the separator (e.g., `|---|`). The wiki hides this row automatically.
3. **Subsequent Rows** are your data.

`| Item | Cost |`
`|---|---|`
`| Sword | 100 |`

___

## Important Notes & Hints

**Headers & Lists inside Tables:**
* You cannot use Headers (`#`) or Lists (`*`) **inside** a table cell. The script only detects these if they are at the very start of a new line. Inside a table, the line starts with `|`, so they will be ignored.
**Workaround:* Use `**Bold**` inside tables instead of Headers.

**Code Blocks & Escaping:**
***Note:** Markdown formatting is **disabled** inside code blocks.
***Protected Text:** `**Bold**` will appear exactly as `**Bold**`, not bold.
***Protected Links:** `[[Link]]` will appear as text, not a clickable link.

**Internal Wiki Linking:**
* To link between pages within this dashboard, use the exact **Name** of the node.
***Quick Link:** Wrap the node name in double brackets: `[[Home]]`
***Custom Text Link:** Use the `wiki:` prefix: `[Click Here](wiki:Home)`

**Image Formats:**
* The script supports direct URLs (e.g., `https://i.imgur.com/example.png`).
* `[imgi]` is perfect for item icons inside tables.
* `[imgs]` is good for side-by-side screenshots.

**Troubleshooting:**
***Table Formatting:** If your table looks broken, ensure the second row contains only dashes and pipes (e.g., `|---|---|`).
***Images Not Loading:** Ensure the URL is a direct link to the image file (ending in `.png`, `.jpg`, etc.), not a link to a gallery page.
***Raw HTML:** HTML tags (like `<b>`) are disabled for security; use the Markdown syntax instead.

# Introduction & Goals of Genesis
> Why does the event server exist in the first place?

Even so, we know that over the last year, for private reasons, we haven‚Äôt met every goal in terms of content pace ‚Äì especially when it comes to onboarding new players. The in-game economy is solid, but not as strong as it could be, and some systems have grown historically rather than being deliberately planned.

This is exactly where our new, one-time event server comes in:

### ‚ÄúBut you already have quite a lot of players?‚Äù ‚Äì Why we‚Äôre launching Genesis anyway
At this point we want to make one crucial thing clear:
***Genesis is not a short-lived ‚Äúspeed server‚Äù** that disappears again after a few months ‚Äì unlike many other new, short-lived projects with other goals that may entice with nice visuals here and there or flashy systems, but whose core isn‚Äôt really well thought out.
***Entropia is a long-term project** ‚Äì stable for years, continuously developed, and carried by a strong, loyal community that has grown over many years and forms the heart of our project.
***Genesis is not a replacement, not a full wipe, and not a throwaway server**, but a time-limited, fully integrated expansion chapter whose progress seamlessly transitions into the main server and continues there permanently.

___
# What Genesis Is Meant to Achieve
> Fresh start, feedback & long-term update

### Fresh start for everyone
Genesis is a time-limited event server (runtime: approx. 5 months) through which we‚Äôre pursuing several goals:
* After almost 5 years without a wipe, we want to offer a one-time, clearly framed fresh start ‚Äì for new, returning, and active players alike.
* Everyone starts at the same time, without old advantages and without pay-to-win baggage.

### A complete journey through Entropia ‚Äì in a modern, streamlined form
* The event server presents Entropia in **‚Äúmilestones‚Äù**.
* Adjusted stats, drop chances, EXP, RXP, GXP, Alchemy EXP, balancing and several new quality-of-life changes.
***Every 1‚Äì2 weeks** new content will be unlocked.
* You experience progression step by step, together with others.
* We can observe where it feels good ‚Äì and where it doesn‚Äôt.

### Targeted feedback for a major live-server update
While Genesis is running, we are simultaneously working on a particularly large and content-rich update for the main server that goes far beyond our usual patches.
* Your feedback from Genesis (EXP, drops, early game, progression, PvE/PvP balance, economy) flows directly into it ‚Äì for example, which changes from the Genesis server should be carried over to the live server after the merge, or what exactly about the concept should be adjusted.
* Suggestions are discussed within the team and with beta testers and then implemented into the large update for the main server.

### Server merge instead of throwing things away
* After roughly five months, Genesis will be merged with the main server.
* Your characters, items (with a few exceptions), and invested time will remain.
* At the same time, the big content update, based on your Genesis experience, will be rolled out.
* It‚Äôs not a ‚Äúnew permanent server‚Äù but a one-time journey whose result transitions into the existing server.

We‚Äôre also using Genesis to realign how we work:
* Instead of ‚Äútoo many construction sites at once‚Äù, we‚Äôre focusing on clearer, long-term plans.
* More focus on new players, progression flow, and a stable, healthy economy.
* Thanks to Genesis, we can evaluate data and feedback (drop rates, EXP, market prices, balance) much more effectively and react more precisely.

In parallel, we‚Äôre developing a major update, parts of which we will showcase on Genesis as a preview before the merge ‚Äì but deliberately not everything. The upcoming update should feel like its own, surprising experience, just like the big Cardia release did back then.

___
# General Gameplay & Comfort
> What to expect on Genesis

Genesis is meant to feel more accessible and rewarding, but not like a ‚Äústressful grind‚Äù. Some core changes:

### General convenience features
* All players have **free access to VIP shop features** and receive more EXP, RXP, Alchemy EXP as well as increased drops and drop chances.
* Many **Anarchy buffs** can be activated directly by players through the Anarchy buff window ‚Äì including *Infinity Power*, *Dove of Luck*, as well as the new **Drop +1 Anarchy buff**, which a single player can trigger for the entire community.
* Easier access to **Entropia Treasures** (farm / shop):
  * Released gradually over time.
  * Additionally integrated as **rare drops in dungeons**.

### Shop system & dungeon entries
* The shop search still shows all player shops but no longer has instant-buy.
* Via right-click you can display the position of shops on the map.
* With premium status you can **teleport directly to a shop up to 5 times per day**.
* Dungeon entries have been reworked:
  * No more mass ‚Äúdungeon checklist‚Äù that feels like work.
  * Focus on meaningful but relaxed gameplay instead of compulsion.

### Guilds & progression
***Guild EXP rate: x5** increased.
***Guild slots limited to 30 members** so that more guilds can quickly reach a usable level and participate in endgame systems after the merge.
  * *‚ûú The slot limit will be raised again after the merge.*
***Infinity points per kill** have been increased to make leveling feel more pleasant and less sluggish.

For certain balance adjustments or milestone releases, we will actively seek feedback and consult with the community ‚Äì for example, how we should design specific content or adjust certain rates. We‚Äôll use targeted surveys for this.

Most ‚Äúhistoric easings‚Äù from recent years remain in place. A few specific features ‚Äì such as **Black Shiny weapons at the Entropia Chip NPC** ‚Äì have been deliberately removed in order to keep progression exciting.

Dungeon drops and some monster/boss values have been adjusted so that runs feel worthwhile and the risk is rewarded appropriately.

___
# Milestones & Duration
> Content unlocking step by step

Game content will be unlocked in **milestones**. Every 1‚Äì2 weeks, new content is added, which then remains active until the merge.
* During this time we‚Äôll make balance changes (PvE, PvP, EXP, drops, Penya, exchangers, NPC costs) if something is too hard, too trivial, or unhealthy for the economy.
* The event server will otherwise remain relatively stable ‚Äì larger system changes are deliberately prepared for the later content update on the main server.
* There will be no brand-new systems or big new content exclusive to the event server: the focus is on feedback, balance, and a fresh gameplay experience.
* We will fix bugs, exploits, or unfair situations as quickly as possible ‚Äì Genesis is not a ‚Äútest server with wild west rules‚Äù but a fully fledged server with clear responsibility on our side.

> **Maintenance:** Adjustments and maintenance will generally take place **every Friday**. Depending on the scope, these may be performed between early morning and evening and usually take around **20 to 40 minutes (+/‚Äì), assuming nothing unexpected happens**.

### Brief overview of the milestones

| **Milestone** | **Date** | **Unlocked content** |
|---|---|---|
| **Milestone 1** | December 5, 2025 | ‚Ä¢ Entropia content up to Platinum 30 ‚Ä¢ Kebaria ‚Ä¢ Aurania ‚Ä¢ Black Shiny content |
| **Milestone 2** | December 19, 2025 | ‚Ä¢ Entropia content up to Platinum 50 ‚Ä¢ Trigrem / Ethral ‚Ä¢ Associated dungeons & Aurania jewelry dungeons ‚Ä¢ Soulreaver content |
| **Milestone 3** | January 2, 2026 | ‚Ä¢ Royal Cardia content up to Royal level 20 ‚Ä¢ Dread Cove Island ‚Ä¢ Royal content |
| **Milestone 4** | January 23, 2026 | ‚Ä¢ Pirate Cave ‚Ä¢ Umbala ‚Ä¢ Astral Forest Dungeon |
| **Milestone 5** | February 13, 2026 | ‚Ä¢ Kogarashi Pass ‚Ä¢ Celestara |

*Some content from earlier milestones will be simplified over time if community feedback suggests that it makes sense. The respective areas are marked as **‚ÄúMilestone‚Äù** in the teleport window.*

___
# Economy, Treasures & Currencies
> How Genesis affects the economy

### Entropia Treasures
**Ultimate Entropia Treasures** will be introduced on Genesis step by step ‚Äì at reduced prices.
* Many will remain as level rewards.
* Some chests will only be integrated into level rewards (P51+ rewards) once they have appeared as event or discounted shop items on Genesis.
* Certain chests will be **rarely farmable** (e.g. not just at the very end like Kogarashi) so that their value remains stable after the merge.
* Additionally, treasures will be available from the **Platinum Exchanger for Perin** ‚Äì we will adjust prices dynamically.

*Example: A standard Entropia Treasure may start at 200 Perin, rise to 300 Perin after two weeks, and the next treasure may go to 400 Perin, etc. ‚Äì depending on the market situation.*

### Currency reset on merge
To keep the economy stable and healthy after the merge, only the major farmable currencies will be removed from Genesis when the server merges:

| **Currencies** | **Status after the merge** |
|---|---|
| Perin, Black Perin, Entropia Chips, Entropia Chip Perin | **Will be reset** (removed) to prevent a huge flood of currency. |
| All other items (gear, fashion, materials, etc.) | **Remain fully intact** ‚Äì including equipment, upgrades, fashion, collections, materials, and more. |

This very clearly means:
**It‚Äôs worth actively investing your currency on Genesis into your characters and equipment**, instead of simply hoarding Perin & co. Your progression (gear, enhancements, builds) remains fully intact, while we prevent a pure money flood from destroying the in-game economy.

___
# Vote System & Diamonds
> Vote items, Blue Diamonds & conversion

### Vote system & vote items
The vote system has a major impact on the economy and prices. To minimize multi-voting abuse:
* All **vote items are bound on Genesis** and cannot be traded.
  * *‚ûú No flood of CW runes, King‚Äôs Hearts & co through account sharing or masses of own alt accounts.*
* You can only start collecting vote points once the new homepage is live.
* There you can choose whether you vote for the main server or the event server (via the homepage or as usual via NPC/in-game ‚Äì with two separate options).

### Red Diamonds & Blue Diamonds
* There are **no Red Diamonds** on the event server.
* Genesis uses only **Blue Diamonds**, which are completely separate from the Red Diamonds of the main server.
  * *‚ûú No one can buy an advantage on Genesis through main-server donations.*
* After the server merge, **Blue Diamonds from Genesis will be converted into Red Diamonds**, so your currency will not be lost and can be used meaningfully on the main server.

___
# Character Names & Adventure Passes
> What happens on merge & which passes return

### Character names after the event server
* Characters with **unique names** that do not exist on the main server will be transferred without any name change.
* If a character name already exists on the main server:
  * the character from the Genesis event server will either receive a **randomly generated name** or
  * the same name with an **appended number**.
  * Additionally, a **Scroll of Forgotten Names (rename scroll)** will be provided.

### Adventure Passes (Battle Passes)
* All Adventure Passes will be playable again over time (**Pass 1 through Pass 8**).
* You can **earn the fashion sets and rewards one more time**.
* Each pass runs for around **1‚Äì2 weeks** and offers manageable challenges with high-quality rewards.
* We‚Äôll keep an eye on effects & rarity so that old exclusivity is not completely devalued.

___
# Loyalty Rewards & Special Bonuses
> A thank you to loyal players

### Loyalty Treasure for long-term players
All players who, between **September 20, 2025** and the day of this announcement (**November 23, 2025**):
* have reached Platinum level 60+ or Royal level 6+ and
* have at least 50+ hours of play time,

will receive a **Loyal Entropia Treasure** containing, among other things:

| **Category** | **Contents of the Loyal Entropia Treasure** |
|---|---|
| Fashion | 6 fashion sets in M/F (including the Bhalri Set, Lixopus Set, Loyalty Set) |
| Badges & Titles | Various badges (including new, exclusive ones for the Genesis start) + Scroll of Title for a custom title |
| Premium & Buffs | Premium (7 days), 2√ó Drop +1 (1 hour each), 2√ó Anarchy Buff Lucky Box |
| Treasure contents | 5√ó Entropia Treasures |

*This chest is a thank you to loyal players without creating an overwhelming advantage. You can claim it at the start of Genesis via the updated homepage for one character on the new cluster.*

___
# PvP & PvE ‚Äì A New Approach
> Transparent balance & less chaos

For PvP, we are trying a new approach to give everyone the cleanest and most understandable PvP experience possible:
* On the event server, **all special PvP effects have been removed**.
* Diamonds have been adjusted: **stat diamonds match PvE diamonds in terms of damage**.
* Some power-ups have been completely removed or slightly reworked to avoid extreme outliers.
* You will only need **one PvE damage equipment set** and one **HP/tank equipment set** ‚Äì no more confusing split into separate PvP gear sets.

The **Battleground mode**, where every player is given a predefined class with fixed equipment, will only be unlocked later during the event server. Until then, the normal PvP mode remains active as usual.

We will continuously work on PvP and PvE balance on the event server:
***Weekly adjustments** if certain classes, builds, or setups are too strong or too weak.
* Some changes will even be tested live via **world buffs**, allowing us to react quickly and incorporate your feedback directly.

___
# Custom Fashion, Recolors & Top Donator Rewards
> Exclusive looks ‚Äì implemented fairly

### Custom fashion / recolors & badges
* All players who have already received a **custom fashion, pet, weapon/recolor or custom badge** via Black Market, top-donator titles or events will receive an additional copy on the Genesis event server.
* Players who bought a fashion set from someone else on the main server will receive that set again, because it was created for them. The players who sold the set will not receive an additional or new copy.
* Please create a ticket with your character name and ideally a screenshot proving you own these items on the main server by **December 10, 2025**.
* These items will be transferred back to the main server during the later merge, so you can **use them twice for alternate characters**.

### Top donator rewards
* The top donators of the months **August, September, October and November 2025** will receive a **custom recolor fashion set** (without effects, based on existing models) on the main server & event server.
  * *(Hat, Suit, Gloves, Boots, Cloak, Mask, 2x Weapon)*
* These sets will be **bound in the wardrobe** to prevent real-money reselling.
* The **top donator in November (on the main server)** (determined on 01.12.) will receive:
  * their regular main server rewards,
  * the desired recolor set on the main server, and
  * the same recolor additionally on the Genesis event server.
* Rare items from earlier top-donator months (e.g. Ripper pets) will **not be reissued on Genesis**, so that everyone can start fairly without huge advantages.

___
# Premium Shop & Quality of Life
> What feels different on Genesis

The premium shop on Genesis contains some items that differ from the main server ‚Äì tailored to the temporary nature of the server.
* There is a new feature allowing you to **send items to offline players** ‚Äì no more being forced to be online at the same time just to gift something (main & event server).
* Some **quality-of-life suggestions from Discord** from recent weeks and months have already been implemented and are active on Genesis.
* A portion of these QoL changes will later be applied to the main server as well.

___
# What We Want to Take Away from Genesis
> Genesis as a tool, not just a one-time show

The event server is not a gimmick, but a major tool to make Entropia better in the long run. Specifically, we want to:
***Rebalance early game & progression** ‚Äì How quickly can you progress meaningfully? Where does it stall in early/midgame?
***Understand economy & prices better** ‚Äì How do treasures, Perin values, exchanger prices, vote items, etc. develop?
***Collect balance data** ‚Äì PvE, PvP, dungeons, boss stats, class performance in a real environment.
***Establish feedback loops** ‚Äì targeted feedback threads, surveys after important milestones, clear roadmap communication.

**Strengthen transparency:**
* We will show clearly which changes on Genesis are only temporary and which insights we will deliberately carry over into the major main server update.
* A roadmap and preview of selected parts of the upcoming update will be published around **1‚Äì2 months before the end of the event server**.
* Enough to give you a sense of direction ‚Äì without spoiling every detail ahead of time.

___
# Frequently Asked Questions & Concerns (FAQ)
> Short answers to things many people are currently wondering about.

### Will the main server stay as it is ‚Äì or are we sacrificing it for Genesis?
The main server will remain and will continue to receive events and seasonal activities during Genesis. There is no wipe and no hidden ‚Äúrestart through the back door‚Äù.
* Your currency, your equipment and your progress on the main server remain intact.
* Genesis runs in parallel and will be integrated into the main server after around five months ‚Äì your main character is unaffected by that.

### Is Genesis just a ‚Äúspeed server‚Äù or test server that gets thrown away afterwards?
Genesis is not a throwaway speed server. It is time-limited, but fully integrated into our project. It serves as a controlled fresh start with a clear runtime and a firmly planned merge into the main server.
* Your characters, your gear, and your invested time will be carried over ‚Äì only specific currencies (e.g. Perin/ECP) will be deliberately reset on merge.
* Genesis is an expansion chapter, not a separate second server that simply disappears at some point.

### Will there be active work on a main server update while Genesis is running?
Yes. Genesis is specifically intended to give us and you breathing room for a larger, cleaner main server update.
* While Genesis is running, the team is working in the background on a substantial content update for the main server which goes far beyond normal patches.
* We don‚Äôt have to ‚Äúcram content in between‚Äù, but can plan, test, and connect it to your Genesis experiences in a calm and structured way.
* This time also serves as a buffer for the team ‚Äì we are not a full-time studio with no private life, and we want to avoid stress and half-finished solutions.

*At the end of Genesis there will not only be the merge, but also a large main server update that benefits directly from the data collected and your feedback.*

### Can you donate on Genesis? Won‚Äôt that become pay2win?
You can donate separately on Genesis ‚Äì but:
* On Genesis there are only **Blue Diamonds**, which are completely separate from the Red Diamonds on the main server.
* No one can buy advantages on Genesis with main-server donations.
* The shop on Genesis is deliberately structured differently: many things are easier to farm and tailored to the temporary nature of the server.
* After the merge all Blue Diamonds from Genesis will be converted into Red Diamonds on the main server, so your currency will not be wasted.

### Will big donators have a ‚Äúcrazy‚Äù advantage on Genesis?
Donations will always provide some advantage ‚Äì otherwise we couldn‚Äôt finance the server permanently. A long-term project like Entropia comes with ongoing costs: marketing, infrastructure, larger server capacities, external support from freelancers, continuous development and much more. We‚Äôre not planning for 1‚Äì2 months, but for many years ‚Äì and that‚Äôs exactly why we need a stable foundation to support the server long term.

At the same time there have always been ‚Äì and still are ‚Äì many players on the main server who have reached endgame and some of the strongest characters without ever donating ‚Äì only through time, knowledge, teamwork and smart investment of their in-game resources.

Nonetheless, the advantage from pure donations on Genesis will remain deliberately limited:
* The most important advantages come from **time, knowledge, teamwork and smart investments**, not just from purchased currency.
* Currencies such as Perin/ECP will be deliberately reset on merge, while real progression (gear, upgrades, builds) remains.
* The shop on Genesis is designed so that many things are farmable ‚Äì a pure ‚Äúmoney-only advantage‚Äù without gameplay isn‚Äôt worth it in the long run.

*Genesis is meant to remain fair ‚Äì and at the same time provide the basis for Entropia to continue and grow as a long-term project.*

### I have a job, family & little time ‚Äì won‚Äôt I fall hopelessly behind?
Genesis is not meant to be a ‚Äúno-life mandatory grind‚Äù.
***Rates are increased**, certain dungeons are capped, and content is released in **milestones** ‚Äì no one can ‚Äúfinish everything‚Äù in week one.
* With more active players there will naturally be more leveling services, more trading, and often cheaper entry-level prices.
* If you have a few days with less time, you can still catch up comfortably ‚Äì and if you‚Äôre not in the mood for Genesis or are waiting for the next milestone, you can simply continue playing on the main server as usual.

### What exactly happens to my characters after the merge?
Your main server characters remain untouched, and Genesis characters are transferred in a controlled way.
***Main server:** Your existing characters keep their currency, equipment and all their progress.
***Genesis:** Your characters will be transferred to the main server ‚Äì including gear, upgrades, fashion, collections and almost all items.
* Only some major farm currencies (Perin, Black Perin, Entropia Chips, Entropia Chip Perin) will be deliberately removed to prevent a money flood.
* If you use the same account, you will simply have more character slots on that account after the merge ‚Äì but you can also play Genesis on a separate account if you prefer.

### What if I just don‚Äôt like the whole concept?
To be completely honest: we know that some of you will love Genesis, while others will feel skeptical or even opposed to the concept ‚Äì that‚Äôs normal with a step of this size.
* The main server remains the heart of the project and your progress there is not devalued.
* You don‚Äôt have to move to the event server if you don‚Äôt want a fresh start ‚Äì you can continue playing on the main server as usual.
* In the long term, you still benefit: through better balance, clearer progression, a more stable economy, and a larger main server update that builds on the five months of Genesis.

*Genesis is not an ‚Äúeither-or‚Äù, but an additional chapter: those who want the event server can dive in fully. Those who prefer to stay on the main server keep their value ‚Äì and will later feel the benefits of the reworked overall concept.*

___
# Final Words
> Genesis ‚Äì origin and beginning at the same time

Our goal with the Genesis event server is to offer you and ourselves, after almost five years without a wipe, a controlled, one-time fresh start ‚Äì without destroying the work of the past years and without dropping the main server the way some new servers do. Entropia remains a long-term project. Genesis is the origin of a new chapter, not a replacement.

**We are fully aware that some of you will love Genesis while others will be skeptical or even opposed to the concept ‚Äì and that‚Äôs okay. What matters to us is that no one feels like the main server is being sacrificed for Genesis and that we address your concerns openly.**

We are taking the time to work on a larger content update instead of ‚Äújust squeezing things in between‚Äù, and we are using these five months to find out, together with you, what Entropia should feel like in the future.

Another thing that is important to us:
* Players who are already far into endgame on the current main server will keep their progress and thus still have a noticeable advantage after the merge and the update.
* Their progress can continue at the start of the event server, since the main server remains actively online for everyone and will also receive events.
* The main server will remain the heart of our Entropia project!
* For some of you, certain content will be easier after the event server merge, while for others ‚Äì who start only on Genesis ‚Äì it will be more challenging.

That‚Äôs exactly how it should be: **Your long-term commitment to Entropia should continue to pay off**, while new players still get a good entry point and understandable progression.

**Please keep in mind:** The changes mentioned here are only a small part of what has been happening in the background. Many other adjustments, optimizations and quality improvements are deliberately not listed in logs but will gradually show themselves in how the game feels. Just play, try things out, and tell us in upcoming surveys what feels good and where we should adjust further ‚Äì this feedback helps us the most.

**If you are unsure about specific points or have particular concerns, you‚Äôll find a brief FAQ above the final words where we answer the most common questions about Genesis, the main server, donations, and the upcoming update in a compact way.**

> The event server therefore does not bear its name by accident:
> **Genesis ‚Äì origin and beginning at the same time.**

1. What this guide covers.description:
## Overview

> **Note:** This guide **only covers a few basic tips** for completely new players to Entropia.
For detailed and up-to-date information, please use the [Official Entropia Discord](wiki:Discord) at or ask the community / Game Masters in-game or on Discord.

We do **not provide a full walkthrough** or tell you how you have to play ‚Äì **explore the game, make your own experiences, and have fun** discovering things together with other players.

___
### Note about simplifications & progression on Genesis
Most of the long-term simplifications and QoL changes are still in the game ‚Äì **that hasn‚Äôt changed**.
However, a few specific shortcuts have been **deliberately removed to keep progression exciting** on the Genesis server. For example, there is no longer free Shiny gear directly from level-ups, which we added to the main server about half a year ago.

On Genesis, the early game will be more populated and the market actually matters, so players are meant to spend some time progressing before the next milestone begins.
We want early and midgame to feel **meaningful again instead of rushing through everything**, and we‚Äôll keep monitoring feedback and can still fine-tune things if something feels off.

___
### This beginner guide explains:
* Basic start: **Buffs, Awakes, Party & Guild**
* Leveling from **1‚Äì175**
***Platinum Levels** (175+) & Genesis milestones
* How to increase **EXP & Damage**
* How to use **Entropia Chip Perin (ECP)** effectively
***Gear progression (Armor):** Shiny -> Black -> Soulreaver -> Royal
***Fashion progression:** Dragon -> Black Dragon -> Gaia (fashion only) -> Ultimate -> Omega
***Weapon progression:** Shiny -> Black -> Soulreaver -> Royal
***Madrigal Statues**, **Item Wiki**, important **hotkeys** & **slash commands**
***Vendor System** (Online/Offline shops)
***Bonus Upgrade Scrolls** for **Black Shiny** and **Soulreaver** gear
* A short **Quickstart checklist**
* Where to get help: **Teleporter, Wiki & Discord**

> **Skip & return whenever you like.**
> This is not a hardcore min-max guide ‚Äì it is here so that you **never feel completely lost**.

2. First steps in-game.description:
## Starting out: Buffs, Awakes & early setup

### 2.1 No main ‚Äústarter quest‚Äù
Entropia does **not** have a classic ‚Äústarter quest line‚Äù that explains everything step by step.
Instead, your start usually looks like this:
* Get **buffs**
* Join or create a **party**
* Join or create a **guild**
* Use the **Teleporter** to find level‚Äëappropriate areas
* Slowly learn systems like **Awakes, ECP, vendor system, dungeons**, etc.

___
### 2.2 Buffs ‚Äì Buff Pang & /buff
Right at the beginning:
* Click on the **Buff Pang** in town to receive strong base buffs
* Or type **/buff** in the in‚Äëgame chat

**Party buffs (Force Master / Seraph)**
If you are in a **party** and a **Force Master or Seraph** stands next to your character:
* Type **/buff**
* You automatically receive **their skill buffs** as well
*This is very useful for leveling in groups and saves you a lot of manual buffing.*

___
### 2.3 First Awakenings ‚Äì /awake / /awa
Very early you can already improve your gear with awakenings:
***/awake** (or **/awa**) ‚Äì Opens the awakening window for the item under your mouse cursor
***/fusionawake** ‚Äì Awakening window for **fusion items** (later)

**Typical stats you might want in general:**
***STR / DEX / INT / STA**
***Critical Damage / Critical Chance**
***HP‚Äërelated stats** depending on your class

### Class‚Äëbased awakening recommendations

| **Class** | **Role** | **Stats** |
|---|---|---|
| Slayer | Physical DD | Crit Dmg & STR |
| Templar | Physical DD | Crit Dmg & STR |
| Crackshooter | Ranged DD | Crit Dmg & DEX |
| Harlequin | Melee/Ranged DD | Crit Dmg & STR |
| Force Master | Physical DD | Crit Dmg & STR |
| Seraph (1on1) | Physical DD | Crit Dmg & STR |
| Arcanist | Magic DD | INT |
| Mentalist | Magic DD | INT |
| Seraph Tank | Tank | STA & HP% |
| Force Master Tank | Tank | STA & HP% |
| Templar Tank | Tank | STA & HP% |

**Short summary:**
***Non‚Äëmagic DDs:** Crit Dmg & STR (except Crackshooter -> needs DEX)
***Magic DDs:** INT
***Tank builds:** STA (and HP%)

> **Awakening costs Penya.**
> With **Premium**, awakening is slightly cheaper. For beginners, simple **positive awakenings** (main stat or HP) are totally fine.

___
### Tips & Tricks

**Tip: Sorting your Teleporter entries**
You can sort the Teleporter by yourself ‚Äì simply click on the Text Location (not the icon) for 1‚Äì2 seconds and move your Teleport Location to a different spot.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/4hUhl0K.mp4

**Tip: Fast bulk item delete**
You can quickly delete many items at once: double-click the trash bin in your inventory to open the bulk delete window. Move all unwanted items into this window and confirm to remove them in one go.

3. Guilds \u0026 Parties.description:
## Guilds & Parties ‚Äì recommended from the start

### 3.1 Joining or creating a guild
We strongly recommend joining a **guild** as soon as possible:
* You gain **guild buffs** (including EXP buffs)
* You get support from more experienced players
* You always have people to ask questions

If there is no suitable guild yet, you can create your own guild with a **Scroll of Create Guild** from **[Cash Shop] Laura** in Flaris (cost: **3,000,000 Penya**).

**Tip:** You can also join a guild via the **Guild Finder** (**Ctrl + G**).

___
### 3.2 Joining or creating a party
Parties give you:
* Better EXP (depending on party settings & size)
* Comfort (e.g. **/buff** with support classes in range)

**Joining a party:**
* Press **L** to open the **Party Finder**
* Join public parties if they are open for members

**Creating a party / inviting players:**
***Right‚ÄëClick** on another player and choose **Party invite**, or
* Use the chat command: **/PartyInvite CharacterName**

4. Leveling 1‚Äì175.description:
## Leveling 1‚Äì175 ‚Äì Classic route

### 4.1 Getting Premium for x2 EXP from the Vote Shop
Premium is a **2x EXP multiplier** on top of your existing EXP %. You can get 1‚Äëday Premium for free via **voting**:

1. Open your browser and go to **entropia.fun**
2. Log in to your **account**
3. On the right side of the homepage, click **‚ÄúVote for 3500 VP‚Äù**
4. Go through the voting process **twice** to get **7000 VP**
5. In‚Äëgame, open **Start -> Premium Items -> Premium Shop**
6. Type **‚ÄúPremium‚Äù** in the shop search bar
7. Buy **Premium (1 Day)**
8. Activate it from your **inventory**

**Premium doubles your total EXP.**
Example: You have **300% EXP** from power‚Äëups -> with Premium you get **600%**.

**Tip:** After activating Premium, relog once (log out and back in) to make sure the Premium bonus is properly active.

___
### 4.2 Teleporter (Hotkey V)
The Teleporter is your main navigation tool:
* Press **V** to open the **Teleporter window**
* There you see towns, leveling maps and many dungeons
***[Instance]** entries (red icon) -> dungeons
***[Zone]** entries (white icon) -> open farming maps
* Each entry shows a rough **level range** for that area
* Many entries also list important **drops / boxes**

**Always** read the description and drop info in the Teleporter.

> **If you are unsure:**
> Check the [[üìñ Entropia Wiki]] (Mainserver data, but ~90% identical for Genesis) or ask in the **Discord** / open a ticket.

___
### 4.3 Classic leveling route (1‚Äì175)
A typical leveling route looks like:
***Flaris**
***Saint Morning**
***Garden of Rhisis**
***Darkon**
* Additional maps via the Teleporter depending on your level

**Simple rule of thumb:**
* Monsters kill you too fast -> **go one area back**
* Monsters die in 1‚Äì2 hits -> **try a higher level area**

**Your main goal for now:**
**‚û° Reach level 175 in a relaxed way.**

5. Platinum Levels \u0026 milestones.description:
## Platinum Levels (175+) & Genesis milestones

### 5.1 Platinum Scrolls & Platinum Exchanger
Once you hit **level 175**, you move into the **Platinum Level** stage.
To gain Platinum Levels, you need **Platinum Level‚ÄëUp Scrolls**:
* You receive some for **free** when creating your character
* You can get more from the **Platinum Exchanger** in Flaris (near **[Arena Manager] Lay**) or via **Start -> Features -> Platinum Exchanger**

Using these scrolls converts your EXP at 175 into **Platinum Levels** and gives you rewards such as:
***Entropia Chip Perin (ECP)**
* Gear, pets, jewelry
* Premium time and more

___
### 5.2 Genesis Server ‚Äì Milestones
On the **Genesis Server**:
* The **first milestone** stops at **Platinum Level 30**
* The **second milestone** unlocks roughly **2 weeks later**

**Your first big target is therefore:**
**‚û° Platinum Level 30**

___
### 5.3 Why Platinum 30‚Äì50 is a good goal
On the way to **Platinum 30‚Äì50**, you gain a lot of **ECP** and rewards.
At **Platinum 30** on Genesis you receive a **Shiny Entropia Platinum Accessorie set**, and you can:
* Start upgrading your **jewelry** using recipes from **[Jewel Manager] Peach**:
  * **Ruby** = STR
  * **Emerald** = DEX
  * **Sapphire** = INT
  * **Topaz** = STA

By around **Platinum 50** you will:
* Know your first dungeons
* Understand basic gear systems (Awakes, upgrades, cards, elements, etc.)
* Have enough ECP and gear for a **stable setup**

___
### 5.4 Exploring farming zones & dungeons (from Platinum 30 onward)
From around **Platinum 30**, it‚Äôs a good idea to actively explore **farming zones** and **dungeons**:
* Use the **Teleporter (V)**
* Check the **[Instance]** (red) entries for dungeons
* Check the **[Zone]** (white) entries for open farm maps
* Each entry shows a **suggested level range** and important **drops / boxes**

**Typical early zones & dungeons after Platinum 30:**
***Eden** ‚Äì Very important for later gear upgrades, including recipes for **Black gear**
***Venux** ‚Äì Important for **Key** items (stronger necklaces) and the **Entropia Unicorn / Entropia Horse** (one of the best buff pets)
* Early dungeons such as **Aminus, Cursed Aminus, Behemoth, Kalgas** ‚Äì used later for jewelry upgrades and other materials

> **General dungeon tips:**
> Read Teleporter descriptions for level & drops, cross‚Äëcheck items in the **Item Wiki**, carry **Scrolls of Resurrection** from **[Cash Shop] Laura**, and ask Discord if you are unsure what is worth farming for your current stage.

6. EXP \u0026 Damage.description:
## Increasing EXP & Damage

### 6.1 Raising your EXP (P0‚ÄìP40)
You don‚Äôt need every buff at once, but these are very useful for beginners:
***Premium (EXP 2x)** ‚Äì Donate / Vote Shop. This 2x multiplier applies to your **entire EXP%**.
***Scroll of Experience (Ultra)** ‚Äì strong EXP boost from the **Entropia Chip Shop**
***Madrigal Medicine** ‚Äì +200% EXP from treasure chests
***Donate EXP Power‚ÄëUp** ‚Äì +100% EXP, Entropia Chip Shop
***Alchemy EXP Flasks** ‚Äì from Beginner Box recipes & the Alchemy NPC
***Online EXP** ‚Äì increasing EXP bonus the longer you stay online (1‚Äì5 hours). This stacks in the same multiplicative way as Premium.
***Guild Buffs** ‚Äì free EXP buffs from your guild
***Couple Buffs** ‚Äì up to +35% EXP at Couple Level 21
* Additional sources like **Diamond Powder, Yellow Balloon, Stay Online Medicine, King‚Äôs Heart, Anarchy Buffs, EXP Glyphs, Furniture**, etc.

**Common beginner EXP setup:**
***Premium + Scroll of Experience (Ultra)**
***Guild buffs + Couple buffs**
* Play longer sessions to benefit from **Online EXP**

___
### 6.2 Increasing your damage (starter phase)
To quickly boost your damage at the start:
1. Buy NPC power‚Äëups at **[Cash Shop] Laura** in Flaris (offensive buffs, Crit / Hit Rate, defensive / HP buffs, etc.).
2. Create a **couple** with another character -> additional damage & HP buffs via Couple Levels.
3. Get a **Shiny Entropia Set** for your class (buy from other players or farm in **Les Britannia / Abysal Cove** dungeons).
4. Upgrade your Shiny Entropia Set to **+10** & insert cards:
   * **(A)‚ÄëRank cards** from **[Jewel Manager] Peach**
   * **Oricalkums / Moonstones** from **Wafor** (Chip merchant) in exchange for ECP
   * **Protect Scrolls** from **[Cash Shop] Laura** to protect items while upgrading
5. Add basic **Awakes** to your gear (use **/awake** / **/awa** and later **/fusionawake**).

**For beginners, focus on:**
* Crit Dmg & main stat (STR / DEX / INT) for DDs
* STA & HP% for tanks
* Clear positive Awakes rather than chasing ‚Äúperfect‚Äù ones

7. ECP \u0026 Gear.description:
## Entropia Chip Perin (ECP) & gear progression

### 7.1 Where do you get ECP?
You gain **Entropia Chip Perin (ECP)** mainly from:
***Platinum Levels**
***Dungeons**
* Regular monster farming in **Platinum‚Äëlevel areas**

If you are leveling and doing dungeons regularly, you will **passively collect** a decent amount of ECP over time.

___
### 7.2 First ECP purchases ‚Äì Wafor & Charly in Flaris

**Wafor (Entropia Chip Merchant in Flaris)**
Good first ECP purchases:
***Vengeful Dragon Set** (Dragon armor set)
***Glorious Dragon Cloak** (Dragon cloak)
***Terminator Sunglasses (White)** or **Wing Mask**
***Oricalkums / Moonstones** for upgrades

These Dragon items become part of your later fashion progression (Dragon -> Black Dragon -> Gaia -> Ultimate -> Omega).

**Important:**
* Pay attention to the **individual effects** these items give
* Check effects by hovering the item tooltip or in the **Item Wiki**
* Preview box contents with **Ctrl + Right‚ÄëClick** on the box

**Charly (Weapon Trader in Flaris)**
At **Weapon Trader Charly**, you can buy a **Shiny Entropia Weapon** for your class using ECP:
* This weapon serves as the base for later upgrades into **Black**
* Black weapons then continue into **Soulreaver weapons** at higher stages

___
### 7.3 Gear & fashion progression

**Very simplified armor gear progression (PvE/PvP gear):**
***Shiny Entropia Set** (Platinum / early gear)
***Black Set**
***Soulreaver Set**
***Royal Set** (very late‚Äëgame)

**Weapon progression:**
***Shiny Entropia Weapon**
***Black Weapon**
***Soulreaver Weapon**

**Fashion progression:**
***Dragon Set & Cloak**
***Black Dragon fashion**
***Gaia fashion** (fashion only, no cloak & mask)
***Ultimate fashion**
***Omega fashion**

In the corresponding farming areas you will also find NPCs offering **Black Destroyed** and **Soulreaver Destroyed** items.
* These are cheaper **‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù versions** of Black and Soulreaver gear.
* They are available directly at NPCs in their **respective zones**.
* They are especially useful if you want to **reroll set bonuses very often** without touching your main gear.
* You use them as **donor items** for Bonus Upgrade Scrolls while keeping your main item safe.

Your early investments into **Dragon items**, **Shiny Entropia gear**, and related upgrades are **not wasted** ‚Äì they are building blocks in this long‚Äëterm upgrade chain.

___
### 7.4 Shiny Entropia Set & Platinum 30 (Genesis)
On the **Genesis Server**:
* At **Platinum Level 30** you should start looking to get a **Shiny Entropia Set** for your class
* This is your first major **progression equipment set**

From here, you can:
* Add **Awakes**
* Upgrade it and insert **cards**
* Combine it with Dragon items, weapons and later Black -> Soulreaver -> Royal gear
* Move your weapon into **Black** and later **Soulreaver**, with merge scrolls and using the bonus upgrade (systems explained later).

8. Madrigal Statues.description:

Across the world of Madrigal, you will find **Madrigal Statues**:

11. Vendor System.description:
## Vendor System ‚Äì Online & Offline shops

### 11.1 Online vs. Offline Vendor
***Online Vendor** ‚Äì Your shop is only active while your character is **online**.
***Offline Vendor** ‚Äì You set up your shop, log out, and your vendor stays active with the right **Offline Vendor** buff.

___
### 11.2 Vendor features
***Shop Bank**: All sold items and remaining items are stored in a **Shop Bank**. If you **close** your vendor or there is a **server restart**, all remaining shop items are automatically moved into the Shop Bank (accessible via **Start -> Shop -> Shop Bank**).
* You receive notifications when items are sold.
* The vendor is a copy of your character (glow, name, guild, visible equipment, icons).
* Rightclick your Vendor to Close it or to add ad banners above your shop vendor.
* You can duplicate your vendor and place the duplicate in another city to reach more people.
* Shop search function to browse shops in a list.
* Multiple currencies (Penya, Perin, special tokens, etc.).
* Access via **Start -> Shop -> ‚Ä¶**

___
### 11.3 Vendor Time
***Online Vendor Time** ‚Äì Earned through dungeon runs, Vote Shop, World Bosses, monster farming, events, etc.
***Offline Vendor Time** ‚Äì Provided as an **item power‚Äëup**, available from Vote Shop, World Boss rewards, Donate Shop, or other players.

Without an Offline Vendor buff your shop remains active only while you are logged in. With an active Offline Vendor buff, it stays up even after you log out.

___
### 11.4 Shop Search & Premium teleport
* Open via **Start -> Shop -> VIP Offers** to see all active player shops (items listed, but not prices).
* To see prices and buy items, go to the corresponding vendor in‚Äëgame.
* With **Premium**, you can up to **5 times per day**:
  * Teleport directly from the shop search to a selected vendor, or
  * Mark the vendor‚Äôs position and walk there yourself.

13. Bonus Upgrade Scrolls.description:
## Bonus Upgrade Scrolls ‚Äì Black Shiny & Soulreaver

Bonus Upgrade Scrolls are advanced endgame tools that let you increase the **bonus stats** on your Black and Soulreaver gear. They always work with a **donor item** (with a higher stat) and a **target item** (the item you keep).

**General rule for all these scrolls:**
* The item on the **left side** of the upgrade window is the **donor**.
* The item on the **right side** is your **target**.
* The left‚Äëside item is **destroyed**; its better stat is transferred to the right item.

___
### 13.1 Black Shiny Bonus Upgrade Scroll (Equipment/Weapon)
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FWLzV8IUkA9qpfnzU3cNW%252FUpgradeScrollEW.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D8741a169-a1eb-4930-b356-3fe253aae4ed&width=400&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=229fd206&sv=2

The **Black Shiny Bonus Upgrade Scroll (Equipment/Weapon)** is a powerful tool that increases the **bonus stats** of your **Black equipment or weapons**.
* Especially useful for items that are already **merged** or enhanced.
* Allows you to push bonuses like **STR, DEX, HP, Crit**, etc. higher.

**How it works ‚Äì step by step**
1. **Identify your target item.** (e.g. Black Slayer Helmet +20 STR). This goes on the **right side**.
2. **Find a compatible donor item.** Same class and part, same stat type but **higher value** (e.g. +22 STR). Can be destroyed/merged.
3. **Prepare and activate the scroll.** Double‚Äëclick the scroll.
4. **Arrange items.** Left: Donor (Higher stat). Right: Target (Lower stat).
5. **Execute.** Click the arrow. Left item is destroyed, right item gets the higher stat.

> **Important:** The item on the **left side** of the window is always destroyed. Make sure you are ready to sacrifice it.

___
### 13.2 Black Shiny Bonus Upgrade Scroll (Weapon Fusion)
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FuiRFwWe8xshAWtG66W5d%252FUpgradeScroxDllF.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D1771e313-7551-419a-9793-7617fe4191a2&width=400&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=8bd228c1&sv=2

The **Black Shiny Bonus Upgrade Scroll (Weapon Fusion)** works on the same principle but is **specifically made for weapon fusions**.
* Used to upgrade the **bonus stats on your fused weapon**.
* You need to create a **new fusion** as the donor.

**Preparing for the upgrade**
1. **Identify your target fusion.** (e.g. Main bow with +18 Crit Dmg fusion bonus).
2. **Create a new donor fusion.** Take a bow with +19 Crit Dmg and fuse it with a ‚Äúcrap‚Äù or destroyed Black bow.

**Using the Weapon Fusion scroll**
1. **Activate the scroll.**
2. **Arrange the weapons.** Left: New donor fusion (higher bonus). Right: Original main fusion (lower bonus).
3. **Execute.** The donor fusion on the left is **destroyed**. Its better fusion stat is transferred to your main fusion on the right.

> **Note:** The entire fusion on the **left side** is destroyed (base + fused item). Always create donor fusions specifically for upgrades.

___
### 13.3 Soulreaver Bonus Upgrade Scroll (Equipment/Weapon)
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FzwYqAPVeF900H0JYIyjb%252FUpgradeScrollEWSR.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da4e9b820-9ef9-46f0-92e5-3e7999645951&width=400&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=4e54046&sv=2

The **Soulreaver Bonus Upgrade Scroll (Equipment/Weapon)** is the Soulreaver equivalent of the Black Shiny scrolls. It is used to upgrade the **unique Soulreaver bonuses** on your items.

**Overview & requirements**
* Works **only** on **Soulreaver items**.
* The **target item** must be a **merged Soulreaver item**.
* The **donor item** must be an **unmerged Soulreaver item**.
* The donor must have the **same stat type** and a **higher or equal stat**.

**Upgrading process**
1. **Prepare your Soulreaver target item.** (Merged item). Goes on the **right side**.
2. **Select an unmerged Soulreaver donor.** Same class & part, higher bonus.
3. **Initiate the upgrade.** Double‚Äëclick the scroll.
4. **Arrange the items.** Left: Unmerged donor. Right: Merged target.
5. **Complete.** The unmerged donor on the left is **destroyed**. Its higher Soulreaver bonus is transferred to the merged item on the right.

> **Warning:** The Soulreaver item on the **left‚Äëhand side** will be **destroyed** during the upgrade. Carefully choose donors you are willing to lose.

14. Collectorfield.description:
## Collectorfield & batteries

The **Collectorfield system** is an engaging feature that lets you gather materials from special collection areas using a **Collector** and **Batteries**. It is a relaxed way to farm useful items while exploring Flarine, Saint City and Darkon.

### 14.1 How it works
***Collector** ‚Äì A device that you deploy in designated collection areas to gather materials over time.
***Batteries** ‚Äì Fuel for your Collector. Different battery types can give very different rewards.
***Collection Areas** ‚Äì Collectorfields in **Flarine, Saint City and Darkon**.
***Rewards** ‚Äì Materials that can be exchanged for **Power‚ÄëUps, Collector Chips** and other forms of Collector currency.
***Collector Master** ‚Äì NPC near each Collectorfield where you can trade materials for rewards.

### 14.2 Collector IP Lock
To keep things fair, there is a **Collector IP Lock** limiting the use of Collectors to **10 characters per IP**. This ensures equal opportunities for everyone.

### 14.3 Collector Batteries
There are many different **Collector Batteries**, and the battery you use strongly affects the rewards you get.
* Some batteries are easy to obtain, others require more effort.
* ‚ÄúStronger‚Äù batteries usually mean **better, more valuable drops**.
* Choosing the right battery for your goal (power‚Äëups, materials, currency) is a big part of the strategy.

### 14.4 Tips for maximizing rewards
***Research first:** Check the Wiki or ask other players which Collector rewards are currently valuable.
***Plan your batteries:** Use batteries that match what you need most (power‚Äëups, chips, currency, materials).
***Check regularly:** Visit your Collectorfield often to swap batteries and collect your items.
***Exchange smartly:** Trade materials at the Collector Master when prices or your needs are best, instead of instantly dumping everything.

15. Infinity Grid.description:
## Infinity Grid ‚Äì Athena‚Äôs gift

The **Infinity Grid** is a powerful endgame system given to you by **Athena**. It uses **Infinity Stones** and **Infinity Points (IP)** to enhance your character over time.
You can find Athena in **Flarine** near the Postbox/Bank office or by teleporting to the entrance of the **Heaven of Madrigal** dungeon.

### 15.1 Earning Infinity Points
You gain Infinity Points (IP) from many activities:
* Defeating regular monsters throughout Madrigal.
* Killing **boss monsters**.
* Completing **daily quests** in Kebaria & Aurania.
* Harvesting in the **Collectorfield**.
* Participating in **Guild Siege / Rumble**.
* Recycling unwanted **Infinity Stones**.

**Boosting IP ‚Äì Infinity IP‚ÄëStone**
The **Infinity IP‚ÄëStone**, available from the Vote Shop, doubles your earned Infinity Points for **one hour**. It is perfect for farm sessions when you want to push your Infinity Grid.

**Weekly farm limit**
You can collect up to **5,000,000 Infinity Points** per week.

### 15.2 Understanding the Infinity Grid
The Infinity Grid is made of **outer stones** and **middle crystals**.
***Outer Stones**: These stones sit on the rim of the grid and give **1 to 5 random status values** each. Inserting or removing them costs roughly **7,500‚Äì25,000 IP** depending on the stone.
***Middle Crystals**: Core nodes that every character starts with. They can be **upgraded indefinitely** using Infinity Points, giving permanent scaling to your stats.

### 15.3 Infinity Stones & where to get them
Infinity Stones, used for the outer slots, mainly drop from:
***Kingdom Heaven of Madrigal dungeon** ‚Äì the primary source with the best drop rates.
***Older dungeons** ‚Äì still have a chance to drop Infinity Stones, but at a lower rate.

Use the **Droplist** from the Teleporter to see where specific stones can drop and to plan your runs.
Each Infinity Stone can roll **1‚Äì5 random effects** (for example: multiple STR+1 lines, combinations like INT+1, Speed+1%, DEX+2, etc.). If you don‚Äôt like the result, you can remove the stone again and try a new one.

### 15.4 Strategy & further reading
The Infinity Grid is designed as a **long‚Äëterm progression system**. By carefully choosing which crystals to upgrade and which stones to use, you can tailor your character for:
* Maximum damage output.
* Tankiness & survivability.
* Utility, hybrid or support playstyles.

Experiment with different stone combinations, recycle bad stones for IP and slowly push your middle crystals to higher levels.

> **For a full deep‚Äëdive:**
> Check the dedicated [[üåê Infinity Grid]] page in the Wiki.

These power-ups are class-specific and cannot be traded.

So you can't take cheaper equipment from another class to get it.
The window is only available from Royal Level 15. (No more job change possible)

The Soulreaver set & weapon must be upgraded to +7!
For the Soulreaver sacrifice, the bonus values of your Soulreaver equipment/weapon are considered (except hands/shoes)

We have a Platinum Level system that can be increased up to level 175 and 99.99% experience by using Platinum Level scrolls. These scrolls can be obtained for free or from an NPC in Flaris. Platinum levels do not provide additional stats, but players will receive items that give stats such as Stat Pets or Accessories for their character. Platinum Level 50 is the highest level that can be achieved through leveling. Players can reach higher levels by completing daily quests, activities, and dungeons. Reaching higher Platinum levels will also unlock additional rewards from the Donate Shop or valuable chests. With the "Myths of Cardia" patch, we introduced the Royal Level system for our endgame players. This system works similarly to the Platinum Level system, but increasing the Royal Level unlocks more game content (2 new level maps and a large zone with different biomes) and strengthens the character with new stats. The Royal Level system has a very low experience rate, but it can be increased through EXP items and occasional Royal EXP events.
***If anyone is wondering how leveling works for new players: Please also check our **[[üî• Beginner Guide]]-> Reach level 175.
- > Platinum level in various areas and receive platinum rewards that strengthen the character.
- > From Platinum 40, the EXP curve is significantly lowered.
- > P50 is the last platinum level.
- > All further platinum levels above P50 are just bonuses that can be leveled through tasks and dungeons.
- > After reaching Platinum 50, the new Royal Level System is introduced, which is built on a low rate but can also be increased with power-ups.
- > Obtain Soulreaver weapons / equipment because otherwise, no damage can be done to the Royal Monsters.
- > RL. 0 to 1 = Complete quests (1-2h)
- > RL. 1 to 6 = Leveling (A bit longer)
- > RL. 6 to 10 = Complete quests (1-3 days depending on playtime / whether you quest solo or in a group)
- > Get Royal equipment / weapons which can be worn from RL. 10.
- > RL. 10 to 15 = Longer leveling, but can be postponed unless one wants to unlock the Trance Mode / Soulreaver Power-Up.
- > RL. 15 to 20 = Longer Leveling on the best Penya Farm Map, where you can get additional Items and access to two of the RL. 15 Dungeons.

**Drop Rate: 8000x (Custom in Mid / Endgame - So that it's not to much)**In addition to our balancements and existing drops and rates, we have added numerous new drops and items throughout Madrigal and our custom content.
Many dungeons are also designed so that you can farm the respective currency from the regular monsters to obtain something.

**Penya Rate: 4000x**Our revised currency system offers a wide range of possibilities for earning and spending Penya. While the rate may seem overpowered at first, players will be surprised by the numerous opportunities available to them.
Job classes that play as 1-on-1 receive double the amount of Penya per killed monster compared to job classes that use AoE skills for farming. This is because AoE classes can acquire very high Penya amounts, and we want to give something back to 1-on-1 players. Despite receiving half the amount per monster, AoE classes farm faster because they can kill multiple monsters in a shorter amount of time.

Ghost DCs / Bad Ping.description:
Ghost DCs (Disconnections) in games refer to instances where players are disconnected from the game server without any apparent reason, usually due to network latency, packet loss, or other connectivity issues. This can be quite frustrating, as it can disrupt the gameplay experience and, in some cases, even result in penalties or loss of progress. Here's a tutorial on how to add a game as an exception in your windows firewall and how using a VPN can help with reducing your ping if you live far away from the game server:
**Adding the game as an exception in your firewall:**
Firewall software can sometimes interfere with the connection between your game and the game server. To prevent this, you can add the game as an exception in your firewall settings.
**a. For Windows Firewall:**
Copy
1. Open the Control Panel by searching for it in the Start menu.
2. Click on "System and Security," then "Windows Defender Firewall."
3. On the left pane, click "Allow an app or feature through Windows Defender Firewall."
4. Click "Change settings" and then "Allow another app."
5. Browse for the game executable file (usually found in the game's installation folder) and click "Open."
6. Ensure both "Private" and "Public" boxes are checked, then click "OK."
**b. For third-party firewall software (VPNs, Servers):**
Copy
The process will vary depending on the software you are using. Please refer to the specific instructions provided by the software's developer.
**Using a VPN to improve connectivity:**
If you live far away from the game server, latency and packet loss can become significant issues. A VPN (Virtual Private Network) can help by routing your connection through a server that is closer to the game server, thereby reducing latency and improving overall connection stability.
We recommend to use the ExitLag VPN, which most of our Players use, but you can also try out a different one. ExitLag VPN also has a Free 3-Day Trial!
a. Choose a reputable VPN provider with servers in the region where the game server is located (France). b. Install the VPN software on your computer. c. Launch the VPN and connect to a server in the desired region. d. Start your game and check for improvements in latency and overall connection stability.
Please note that while a VPN can help in certain situations, it may not always result in better performance. Some game servers may even block or restrict VPN connections (Entropia Allows it), so it's essential to verify that the VPN you are using is compatible with the game you are playing.
By following these steps, you can potentially reduce the occurrence of Ghost DCs in your gaming experience, leading to a smoother and more enjoyable time while playing.

* *Entropia is not designed to run natively on MacOS. However, there are other ways to make it work, such as using Windows emulation.**
To play a DirectX 9 game (Entropia PC) on macOS, you will need to use a Windows emulator or virtualization software. This will allow you to create a virtual Windows environment on your Mac, in which you can install and run the game.

Some popular options for Windows emulators on macOS include:

**Wine:** an open-source program that allows you to run Windows applications on multiple platforms, including macOS. *Tutorial:*[*https://pastebin.com/raw/bmkmzK7W*](https://pastebin.com/raw/bmkmzK7W)****Parallels Desktop:** a commercial virtualization software that allows you to install and run Windows and other operating systems on your Mac. *Tutorial:*[*https://pastebin.com/raw/78HxgPJX*](https://pastebin.com/raw/78HxgPJX)****VMware Fusion:** another commercial virtualization software that allows you to run Windows and other operating systems on your Mac. *Tutorial:*[*https://pastebin.com/raw/2NnbsQQB*](https://pastebin.com/raw/2NnbsQQB)****Crossover:** Crossover is a commercial software that allows you to run Windows applications on your Mac. *Tutorial:*[*https://pastebin.com/raw/G8Gb4BYb*](https://pastebin.com/raw/G8Gb4BYb)**It's important to note that not all games will work perfectly on emulators or virtualization software, and you may experience performance issues or other problems. It's always a good idea to do some research and test the game in the virtual environment before committing to it.

Also make sure that you have the required drivers installed on your virtual machine:

Bugsplat / Crashes.description:
As a player, if you frequently encounter Bugsplats (client crashes), it's important to submit the Bugsplat reports with your name included, so the developers can investigate the issue. Additionally, it's recommended to try the following steps to potentially resolve the problem:
1. **Completely reinstall the game client:**This can help eliminate any issues caused by older client folders or missing files, as these are common causes for multiple client crashes.
2. **Install the appropriate drivers for your hardware:**Ensure that your computer's drivers, especially for your graphics card, are up-to-date, as outdated drivers can cause compatibility issues and crashes.
3. **Check if the game functions properly with the reinstalled client and updated drivers:**This will help you determine if the previous crashes were caused by the older client or missing files.
4. **Restart your computer:**After completing the above steps, it's always a good idea to restart your computer to ensure that any changes made are fully applied and any potential lingering issues are resolved.
By following these steps, you can minimize the occurrence of Bugsplats and improve the stability of your gaming experience.

Better Performance.description:
1. **Adjust your game settings:**a. Start by launching the game and accessing its settings menu (Start -> Options). b. Look for graphics or performance settings, and set the resolution, texture quality, and other options according to your hardware capabilities. If you have a powerful CPU and GPU, setting the options to High might help fully utilize your system, while a weaker system might require lower settings for better performance.
2. **Optimize Windows power settings:**a. Right-click on the battery icon in the system tray (bottom right corner) and select "Power Options." b. In the Power Options window, choose the "High Performance" plan. If it's not visible, click on "Show additional plans" to reveal it. c. Close the window. This will ensure that your computer's power settings do not throttle your game performance.
3. **Update your graphics drivers:**a. Visit your GPU manufacturer's website (NVIDIA, AMD, or Intel) and download the latest graphics drivers for your specific model. b. Install the drivers and restart your computer for the changes to take effect.
4. **Optimize your GPU settings:**a. Open your GPU's control panel (NVIDIA Control Panel, AMD Radeon Settings, or Intel Graphics Control Panel). b. Locate the settings related to gaming or 3D applications, and adjust them for better performance. For example, you may want to enable "Prefer Maximum Performance" in the NVIDIA Control Panel or "High Performance" in AMD Radeon Settings.
5. **Disable unnecessary background processes:**a. Press Ctrl+Shift+Esc to open the Task Manager. b. Click on the "Processes" tab, and sort the list by CPU or memory usage. c. Carefully close any non-essential processes that are consuming significant resources.
6. **Adjust in-game settings:**As mentioned earlier, setting the game options to High instead of Low can help fully utilize your CPU. This is particularly true for systems with powerful CPUs and GPUs, as running the game on low settings might cause the CPU to wait for the GPU, resulting in lower overall performance. Experiment with different settings to find the best balance between performance and visual quality for your specific hardware.
By following these steps, you can optimize your gaming experience and achieve the best possible performance based on your computer hardware. Remember that every game and system is different, so you may need to tweak these recommendations to match your unique setup.
**Entropia** is a One core CPU-based game with some quirks (and the drawbacks that come with being a One core CPU-based game). Although the performance in Entropia has been significantly improved, the older base code of the game prevents a massive overhaul. As a result, particularly in cities with many players, frame (FPS) drops may occur due to the Glow effects (SFX) that need to be loaded and rendered. This process consumes a lot of performance, as it is only handled by a single core of your CPU.
A One core CPU-based game like this can suffer from performance issues because it relies heavily on a single core of the processor to handle most of the game's tasks. This means that even if you have a multi-core processor, the game won't take full advantage of the additional cores, resulting in limited performance improvements. Consequently, players might experience slowdowns, especially in areas where there is a high concentration of players and visual effects, such as cities.
Otherwise, for some locations, you can permanently, temporarily, or partially hide players, pets, and glow effects in your in-game options to achieve more frames (FPS).
Additionally, you can **use the keybinding Ctrl + P to toggle hiding and displaying players** if you experience lag in crowded areas with many players.

After gathering some Entropia Chip Perin (ECP), you might be wondering what to do next. Here's a guide:

2. Use your accumulated ECP to purchase the following items:* Vengeful Dragon Set

After Platin 50.description:
## Congratulations on Reaching Platinum Level 50!
Reaching Platinum Level 50 is a significant achievement, but the journey doesn't stop here. The world of Kebaria and Aurania offers endless adventures for those looking to push the limits. Here‚Äôs what you can do beyond Platinum Level 50:
___
### Continue the Adventure
***Level Beyond Platinum Level 50:**Leveling up beyond Platinum Level 50 is optional. Continue to earn Activity EXP through diverse in-game activities to unlock new challenges and rewards.
___
### How to Earn Activity EXP for P50+ ~ P100+
***Dungeon Runs:**Team up with friends or other players to conquer challenging dungeons.
***Complete Daily Quests:**Kebaria and Aurania are filled with daily quests that yield generous Activity EXP and rewards.
***Participate in Events:**Join server-side events like the Guild War for a unique chance to earn additional EXP and exclusive items.
___
### Boost Your Progress
* Take advantage of power-ups or buffs available during weekend events to speed up your Activity EXP gain.
___
### Gear Up
***Farm Guild Activities:**Participate in activities like Battlegrounds or Guild Siege to get some goodies and Buffs.
***Join Dungeons:**Dive into custom content dungeons for exclusive gear and challenges.
Embark on this next phase of your journey with confidence. The path ahead is filled with opportunities to strengthen your character and forge lasting alliances. Ready, set, grind!
___
## Equipment / Weapon Route
***Early:**Shiny Set / Weapons (Les Britannia / Abyssal Cove Dungeon)
***Midgame:**Black Shiny Set / Weapons (Kebaria / Aurania Map)
***Late Midgame:**Soulreaver Set / Weapons (Ethral / Trigrem)
***Endgame:**Royal Set / Weapons (Cardia & RL 10+ Dungeons)
From Shiny onwards, you'll need the current set to reach the next weapon/equipment level. You'll then have to merge your Shiny with destroyed Black Shiny items to create a intact Black Shiny item part, which you can then wear for higher effects.
The bonus stats from the Shiny set won't be carried over when merging with a destroyed Black Shiny part.
When merging Black Shiny with a destroyed Soulreaver item, the bonuses from the Black Shiny part will combine with the Soulreaver part, giving you two bonus stats on your new part.
You'll need the Soulreaver set and weapons if you're leveling up from Royal Level 0 to 10 yourself. Only with the Soulreaver weapons can you deal damage to the monsters!
For endgame Royal equipment, you won't need to merge your equipment anymore. The Soulreaver items can then be converted into a special HP & damage buff, which becomes stronger if you have good Soulreaver equipment.
___
### Comprehensive Upgrades
***Beyond Equipment:**Upgrade not only your equipment but also pets, accessories, and fashion equipment. Each starts at a base tier and can be incrementally improved to higher versions through farming or upgrading.
This guide should serve as a foundational reference for your in-game advancement, focusing on both character progression and comprehensive equipment upgrades.
___
## Royal Level System Guide
If you're new to the game or prefer a standard progression route, there's no immediate need to concern yourself with the Endgame Royal Level System. It becomes relevant once you achieve a very Good Equipment and Platinum Level 50 or higher, at which point you can initiate a Royal Questline in Flarine. Completing this questline advances you from Royal Level 0 to 1.
To effectively combat Royal Level monsters, it's essential to acquire Soulreaver weapons and equipment, previously considered endgame items, from the Ethral/Trigrem region. Preparing for this challenge is a significant undertaking and will be detailed in a separate, dedicated guide.

## Shiny Entropia Equipment Dungeons:
Les Britannia and Abyssal Cove The bosses drop shiny entropia treasure chests, so try your luck obtaining the parts you need (or as mentioned above, buy them from other players). The bonus on these items doesn‚Äôt really matter as they won‚Äôt transfer to your black equipment upon merging, but the higher the stat the more damage or HP you‚Äôll obtain.
Shiny Entropia Weapons Weapons can be bought for 100 ECP each ([which you‚Äôll earn when levelling to platinum level 50](beginner-guide/what-comes-after-level-175.html#platin-level-rewards)) at Weapon Trader Charly in Flaris.
___
### Upgrading your Shiny Gear:
You‚Äôll want to upgrade your weapon and equipment to at least +10. You can do this in Flaris at the Upgrade Specialist BoboChan. Choose the safe upgrade option. For your weapon you will need shiny oricalkum (you get these dropped when killing monsters) and scrolls of XProtect (can be bought at Cash Shop Laura in Flaris. For your equipment you‚Äôll need sunstones (dropped when killing monsters) and scrolls of SProtect (buyable at Laura NPC).
You‚Äôll also want to pierce your suit (4 times) and weapons (10 times). You can also do this at BoboChan. In order to do this you‚Äôll need moonstones (dropped from killing monsters) and scrolls of GProtect (buyable at Laura NPC). All classes (except for magic classes) will need to put an element on their weapon and suit for maximum damage. You can also do this at BoboChan. For this you will need Elemental Cards and scrolls of GProtect from Laura again. A and 7% cards can be bought at Jewel Manager Peach in Flaris. Better cards can be bought from players or farmed in Rhisis‚Äô Trail. You might already want to put diamonds in your weapon. You can do this at Jewel Exchanger Peach in Flaris. Diamonds can be bought or farmed in numerous dungeons (press V and check the drop log in the teleporter to see which dungeons drop the diamonds). Inserting diamonds never fails.
**Also Check the Shiny Content Area in our Wiki:** [Shiny](../custom-content/shiny.html)
___
## Black Shiny Entropia Equipment Dungeon:
Magma Cave The boss drops individual set parts, so try your luck!
Black Shiny Entropia Weapon Dungeon: Aurania Temple The boss drops black weapon materials and the occasional black shiny weapon box. The black material can be exchanged at Aurania Quest Exchanger Tina for those weapon boxes. The bonuses on these equipment parts and weapons matter, not only for damage and HP purposes but also in endgame for your [soulreaver sacrifice](../systems/soulreaver-sacrifice.html).
___
### Merging Shiny to Black:
For merging your equipment you‚Äôll need scrolls of armour merge which can be found at Kebaria Exchange Maria. By using the scroll of armour merge (special), you‚Äôll get to keep your awakenings when merging from shiny to black, if you use the normal scrolls, your awakenings will be lost and you‚Äôll have to reawaken your Black Shiny Set. Upgrade levels and cards are kept. For merging your weapons you‚Äôll need scrolls of weapon merge which can be found at the Aurania Quest Exchanger Tina. Upgrade levels and cards are kept. Diamonds will be lost unless you use magic diamonds to remove the diamonds at BoboChan before merging. This isn‚Äôt recommended though unless you are using spirit diamonds already.
**Tutorial for Black Equipment Merging:** [Click Here!](../sets-weapons-and-items/merge-system/how-do-i-merge-a-black-shiny-equipment.html)
**Tutorial for Black Weapons Merging:** [Click Here!](../sets-weapons-and-items/merge-system/how-do-i-merge-a-black-weapon.html)
___
### Upgrading your Black Shiny Gear:
If you haven‚Äôt already, you‚Äôll want to upgrade your Black Shiny Equipment and Weapons to +20. From levels 1 to 10 you‚Äôll use shiny oricalkum and scrolls of XProtect for weapons and sunstones and scrolls of SProtect for set pieces. From 10 ‚Äì 20 you‚Äôll need scrolls of UProtect (Ultra) and ultra sunstones (weapon and equipment). You can get these items at the shiny dungeon exchangers or buy them from players. Don‚Äôt forget to insert diamonds in your weapons if you haven‚Äôt already!
**Also Check the Black Shiny Content Area in our Wiki:** [Black](../custom-content/black.html)
___
## Soulreaver Equipment:
Dungeon: Trigrem Ruins
The boss drops individual set parts.
___
## Soulreaver Weapons:
Dungeon: Ethral Garden
The boss drops Soulreaver Relics and the occasional soulreaver weapon box.
These relics can be exchanged for weapon boxes at the NPC exchanger Raziel in Ethral.
**Also Check the Soulreaver Content Area in our Wiki:** [Soulreaver](../custom-content/soulreaver.html)

## Merging Black to Soulreaver:
For merging your equipment you‚Äôll need scrolls which can be found at the Trigrem Exchanger Soran. For merging your weapons you‚Äôll need scrolls of weapon merge (soulreaver) which can be found at the Ethral Exchanger Raziel.

**Tutorial for Soulreaver Equipment Merging:** [Click Here!](../sets-weapons-and-items/merge-system/how-do-i-merge-a-soulreaver-equipment.html)

## Royal Equipment & Weapons!
After Soulreaver, players can look forward to unlocking Royal Equipment and Weapons. These items do not require merging of previous items like the Soulreaver. They become available for equipping once a player reaches Royal Level 10, or at Level 6 for those using a Boost Token.

Weapons and equipment can be acquired as drops from the Destruction Cavern or Azmore Forest Dungeon. Additionally, Loot Orbs, which may contain one of these items randomly, can also be obtained. Alternatively, you can purchase them from other players using in-game currency.
For players aiming to progress from Royal Level 0 to 10 without utilizing boosts, the Soulreaver is crucial. Monsters cannot be damaged without a Soulreaver Weapon, and without a high-quality Soulreaver Set, your HP may not withstand the Monsters' attacks.
Furthermore, the previously mentioned Soulreaver equipment and weapons become necessary for crafting special power-ups and a unique character mode (Trance) as you progress further in the game, starting from Royal Level 15. The quality of your Soulreaver set determines the strength of the buffs you receive.

### Farming Magical Keys in Venux
When adventuring in Venux, players have the option to farm two types of powerful magical keys:
***Powerful Magical Key of Monsters (DMG)**
***Powerful Magical Key of Blessing (HP)**
To initiate the quest, engage with the Kablloc NPC for trades. However, exercise caution as Venux is a PVP (Player vs. Player) zone, posing a risk of death. Upon death, farmed quest items are lost, unless a protective measure is taken.
___
#### Protective Measures:
***Venux Charm**: This charm safeguards your farmed quest items upon death. It can be acquired from other players or purchased at Wafor in Flaris for 25 ECP.
* A**Venux Charm**variant from the Vote Shop offers 50% protection of the farmed quest items upon death.
___
#### Upgrading Keys:
* In Venux, players can also farm for the first upgrade of these powerful keys.
* Recipes for the upgrades can be obtained from Kablloc.
* For later upgrades, seek the**Blessed Variant**of your key. These can be either purchased from other players or occasionally found in **Lucky Box of Blessed Key Recipe Treasures
___
