Aminus/Cursed Aminus.description:
The Aminus Dungeon is a crucial point in your journey through the game and represents a significant step up from the earlier dungeons of [Kalgas Cave](kalgas-cave.html) and [Ankou's Asylum](ankous-asylum.html). Here, you will encounter new and challenging monsters, and you will need to approach battles more strategically to be successful.
For this dungeon, you will need **700.000 HP** and a [Kalgas Set](kalgas-cave.html) to deal sufficient damage. As previously mentioned, the main currency in the Aminus Dungeon is the rune. These runes are essential for obtaining items that will help you progress in the game, such as fairies or your first jewelry set. The [Alchemy System](../../../systems/alchemy.html), which allows you to craft various items, becomes available in this dungeon, and a good supply of runes is essential if you want to create powerful equipment.
It's worth noting that runes can be used multiple times throughout the game, so it's always a good idea to farm them whenever possible. An excess of runes will be useful in the long run, as they can be used for many different things, from crafting to trading.
Overall, the Aminus Dungeon is a crucial milestone on your journey, and it's a good idea to prepare before entering. Make sure you have enough runes, equipment, and party members to be successful, and don't be afraid to explore and try out different strategies to find what works best for you.
[You can see the map of Aminus here.](../../../../files.gitbook.com/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces/b31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu/uploads/JNLg7Ksh3IuM0YPH235n/Cursed_Aminus2675.png?alt=media&token=fdd7de65-f3ca-4052-a23d-fea065ea2889)
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FTsfNMuIYs4leguwbxYUO%252Faminus.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5c91494c-16c5-4290-ade8-546b82c4d279&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=299ec36b&sv=2

Catacombs.description:
The Catacombs are an important part of the game as they provide access to many valuable alchemy recipes. They are a necessary step in advancing to the mid-game and farming some essential items. Like in the [Kalgas Cave](kalgas-cave.html) and [Ankou's Asylum](ankous-asylum.html), players will need **500.000 HP** and a moderate damage output to successfully navigate the Catacombs.
In this dungeon, players will need to gather both coins and runes to unlock valuable items and recipes. The coins can be used to purchase weapons and other items from the NPC at the entrance of the dungeon. Meanwhile, runes are required for crafting powerful [alchemy items](../../../systems/alchemy.html), which are essential for advancing in the game.
It's worth noting that the Catacombs are an excellent source of both coins and runes, making them an excellent spot for players looking to farm these essential resources. With enough time and patience, players can accumulate a large quantity of both coins and runes, which can be used to craft powerful equipment and items later on.
In summary, the Catacombs are a crucial dungeon that players must navigate to progress to the mid-game. With the right gear and strategy, players can farm valuable coins and runes and unlock essential alchemy recipes. So, make sure you're well-equipped and prepared before entering the Catacombs.
[You can see the map of Catacombs here.](../../../../files.gitbook.com/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces/b31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu/uploads/BvO5ECUEkyVJePlaHmLK/400px-Catacombs_of_Anguish_Dungeon_Mapf6a8.png?alt=media&token=72c97085-792f-4af1-a208-2f5bd6a5c64d)
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FeWYs2OxB18GKRPBmbjOH%252Fcata.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D22898811-4678-4cf0-971e-51aa83b7840d&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=e01d7a09&sv=2

Wilds/Savage Wilds.description:
The Wild Dungeons may not hold the highest priority in Entropia, but they are still quite significant. In these dungeons, you will need runes, but they can only be obtained by defeating the end boss. However, you will receive more than three runes at a time, and the number can vary.
Apart from the runes, you can also obtain level 3 beads that will greatly enhance your damage output. Furthermore, you can purchase models and power-ups using the runes from the Wilds Exchanger NPC located outside the dungeon.
While not as critical as some other dungeons, the Wild Dungeons are still worthwhile to explore. The rewards may not be as plentiful, but they can still be quite useful in enhancing your character's abilities. So, be sure to visit the Wild Dungeons when you're ready for a new challenge and to acquire some valuable items to aid you in your journey.
[You can see the map of Wilds here.](../../../../files.gitbook.com/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces/b31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu/uploads/4Di912zsx2UmSbq859Z0/400px-The_Savage_Wilds_Dungeon_Map519e.png?alt=media&token=0cd1d9b7-6abe-44da-8374-84b1bed30252)

Venux.description:
If you are interested in obtaining your own Powerful/Holy/Blessed Key for the necklace slot, which is considered the best in slot option, you will need to venture to Venux and engage in some monster slaying. However, there are some important restrictions to keep in mind.
First and foremost, teleportation is prohibited in the entire Venux area, with the exception of designated safe zones which are marked by small water pools. Additionally, if you are killed by another player while in Venux, you will lose all of the quest items you have farmed there. It's important to note that your quest items are not even safe in your bag, but there is a helpful scroll called V**enus Charm (Drop Protection+)** which can prevent you from losing your items if you happen to die.
Furthermore, it's important to know that you will not be able to use the Mailbox, Guildbank, or Bank while in the Venux area. All of these factors combined make Venux a very challenging and potentially dangerous place, so it's important to exercise caution and take all necessary precautions before embarking on your quest.

[You can see the map of Venux here.](../../../files.gitbook.com/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces/b31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu/uploads/4ZEgUXW8b9wMvfT53jn1/Venuxe913.jpg?alt=media&token=3212e8b9-902f-4304-8cae-9230e20e7fcd)

Kanto.description:
Kanto is an Event Dungeon, designed as a Singleplayer - and Adventure mode.
There are serveral different things to do in this dungeon, such as completing the storyline, questing, quiz solving and more.
Note: This Dungeon is a giant, however it doesn't include the entire Kanto as it is known by Pokemon. There are serveral changes made by us regaring to story and layout of the Map.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FwzB0XBCl4LodkAD2CC9D%252FKanto.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D8f259a6b-9e6f-4b45-99d7-645c30c0cee8&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=5b56e994&sv=2

Interactive Objects.description:
The Dungeon includes different objects where Players are able to click on. We call them "Interactive Objects". Some of them require specific items to take effect, while others can be clicked without any requirements.
**Pokeballs:**
* Usage*: Dropping a random Amount of Rare Candies between 0 and 3.

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon. Some Pokeballs are typically located at hidden places which are mostly not too obviously.

* Requirements*: None
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2Ff%2Ff2%2FPballCtrl.gif%2F200px-PballCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=c709e65b&sv=2
**Plants:**
* Usage*: Having a chance of dropping Rare Candies, Razz Berries and Razz Berries(Silver).

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon, especially inside Buildings and Rooms. Some plants can be shaked but dont drop items.

* Requirements*: None
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F7%2F71%2FPlantCtrl.gif%2F200px-PlantCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=27e79244&sv=2
**Balloons:**
* Usage*: Having a chance of dropping Skydash Balloons.

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon, but kind of rare. Balloons are available in different colors, which does not affect the drop rate.

* Requirements*: None
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F6%2F67%2FBalloonCtrl.gif%2F200px-BalloonCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=c64aa49a&sv=2
**Berry Trees:**
* Usage*: Having a chance of dropping Razz Berries, Razz Berries(Silver) and Razz Berries(Gold).

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon.

* Requirements*: None
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F8%2F87%2FBerryTreeCtrl.gif%2F200px-BerryTreeCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=7e4f9ba2&sv=2
**Garbage Cans:**
* Usage*: Dropping a random Amount of Rare Candies between 0 and 3.

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon.

* Requirements*: None
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F1%2F1a%2FGarbageCanCtrl.gif%2F200px-GarbageCanCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=7220a1d0&sv=2
**Masterball:**
* Usage*: Has a chance to drop a Masterball Luckybox that contains a random rare Pokemon Pet!

* Occurrence*: Bills Quiz U3, at the secret Masterball-Room. Can be opened every day.

* Requirements*: None
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F9%2F9c%2FMasterballCtrl.gif%2F200px-MasterballCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=b26b1f42&sv=2
**Doors:**
* Usage*: Takes the player to the environment behind the door.

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon. Appears in a lot of different variations.

* Requirements*: Rarely requires to own specific items or active/completed quests.
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2Fd%2Fd6%2FDoorsCtrl.gif%2F200px-DoorsCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=2506231b&sv=2
**Teleporter:**
* Usage*: Takes the player to an other place.

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon. Teleporters appear in different variations, such as other colors or even look like statues or stairs.

* Requirements*: Does sometimes require to own specific items or quests.
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F3%2F31%2FTeleporterCtrl.gif%2F200px-TeleporterCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=5aac7e1e&sv=2
**Movable Objects:**
* Usage*: These objects can be moved and basically act like a door or trigger something else.

* Occurrence*: Appears in different variations on some locations of the dungeon.

* Requirements*: Does sometimes require to own specific items or quests.
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F0%2F09%2FMoveableObjectsCtrl.gif%2F200px-MoveableObjectsCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=7c261e68&sv=2
**Rocks:**
* Usage*: Having a chance of dropping Rare Candies, Thunder Stones, Water Stones and Fire Stones. Some Rocks are blocking paths and need to get destroyed to pass. Sometimes there can be a Pokeball hidden inside a Rock.

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon. Rocks have a chance to stun upon getting destroyed.

* Requirements*: You need to have the item HM: Rock Smash in your inventory.
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2Ff%2Ff2%2FRockCtrl.gif%2F200px-RockCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=cd4568bb&sv=2
**Trees and Bushes:**
* Usage*: Some Trees and Bushes are blocking paths and need to get destroyed to pass.

* Occurrence*: All over the Dungeon but rare.

* Requirements*: You need to have the item HM: Cut in your inventory.
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F4%2F4f%2FHmCutCtrl.gif%2F200px-HmCutCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=7813c8db&sv=2
**Charizard Mount:**
* Usage*: Takes the player to Cinnabar Island.

* Occurrence*: Appears in Viridian City and Lavender Town

* Requirements*: You need to have the item HM: Fly in your inventory.
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F6%2F64%2FHmFlyCtrl.gif%2F200px-HmFlyCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=89a3ef55&sv=2
**Heavy Gates:**
* Usage*: Takes the player to the place behind the Heavy Gate.

* Occurrence*: Appears rarely in Rooms and Undergrounds.

* Requirements*: You need to have the item HM: Strength in your inventory.
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F3%2F35%2FHmStrengthCtrl.gif%2F200px-HmStrengthCtrl.gif&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=2b15d44a&sv=2

Gaia Forest.description:
The Gaia Forest is a formidable dungeon that is required to obtain the Gaia Fashion, which is a crucial component in obtaining the [Ultimate Fashion](../../sets-weapons-and-items/ultimate-items.html). This dungeon is not for the faint of heart and requires a great deal of preparation before venturing in.
To successfully navigate this dungeon, a player must possess at least **1.000.000 HP** and have significant damage output. Additionally, equipping oneself with black gear will greatly enhance the chances of success.
One of the most challenging aspects of the Gaia Forest is the final boss, who can deliver devastating blows in rapid succession. It is essential for players to have access to quick and effective healing options to keep their HP levels high and stay in the fight.
Overall, the Gaia Forest represents a significant challenge for players looking to acquire the coveted [Gaia Fashion](../../sets-weapons-and-items/gaia-set-extension/gaia-set-exchange.html). It demands a high level of skill, patience, and perseverance, but the rewards for those who successfully conquer it are well worth the effort.

Rhisis Trail.description:
Rhisis Trail is a dungeon that is primarily aimed at midgame players, but it remains a valuable resource for endgame players as well. This dungeon offers players access to powerful Scroll of Holys and Remantis Laccotten, both of which can be extremely useful in combat.
To successfully navigate Rhisis Trail, players will need to have at least **800.000 HP** and a solid damage output. The use of a [Black Set](../black.html) is highly recommended to ensure a smoother journey through the dungeon.
While the small monsters found in Rhisis Trail may not provide players with significant benefits, defeating the Vorbosses and the final boss is essential for acquiring valuable Mystical Card Piece Boxes. These boxes contain R Card Pieces and 12% Card Pieces, which can be used to create R and 12% Cards by exchanging them with **[Card Manager] Jane**.
These R and 12% Cards can be used to create even more powerful [Z and 15% Cards](../../guides/card-upgrade.html), making Rhisis Trail a critical resource for players seeking to enhance their abilities and strengthen their characters.
Overall, Rhisis Trail offers a challenging and rewarding experience for players looking to acquire rare and powerful items. Its powerful bosses and valuable drops make it an essential dungeon for midgame players, and its unique items and resources can help endgame players gain an edge in their adventures.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FknLBUWJMW9uVaAvjttXz%252FRhisis%2520Trail.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D7f5a3cb9-1f33-4c8b-8a73-82b09fde4b3b&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=75241c0d&sv=2

Golem Temple.description:
The Golem Temple is a dungeon that specializes in [upgrading fashion](../../sets-weapons-and-items/fashion-upgrade.html) items. Players can obtain various types of **gems**for their Helm, Suit, Gaunts, and Boots, as well as **stones** for upgrading, **safescrolls**, and **gem reversions.** While the dungeon itself is relatively straightforward, it is more suitable for advanced players who have attained at least **1.800.000 HP** and a high damage output, preferably with a [Soulreaver](../soulreaver.html) damage equipment.
As the dungeon consists solely of bosses, AoE skills are not recommended. Every character participating in the dungeon should have a certain minimum HP of at least **900.000** to survive. Overall, the Golem Temple is an essential dungeon for players looking to upgrade their fashion items and enhance their characters' combat capabilities.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FCxaEby1S1AxkERHvMJa7%252Fgtemple.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0ff1f920-b4f5-4a19-98a2-2f0660898e7b&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=ea8526f&sv=2

Heaven of Madrigal.description:
Heaven of Madrigal is an incredibly useful dungeon that provides players with many valuable cards, skins, and stones that can be recycled into [Infinity Points](../../systems/infinity-grid.html)-Scrolls. While **2.000.000 HP** is sufficient to enter the dungeon, the main challenge lies in dealing a significant amount of damage, preferably with a [Soulreaver](../soulreaver.html)equipment set.
A [Tank who can self-heal](../../balance/self-sustain-tank.html) is highly recommended for this dungeon, as well as a powerful 1-on-1 damage dealer. Holys are crucial for the dungeon, and Laccotten will not suffice. The damage dealer should also have a certain minimum HP of **1.000.000** to ensure survivability.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252F6NVQXrlPpwQaLGSJckwf%252FHeaven.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dea94237c-deca-41e2-938b-7f14e5b9b743&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=b15ed885&sv=2

Les Britannia.description:
Les Britannia is one of the two Shiny Dungeons, and it requires you to have **800.000 HP** and a solid base damage, which you can achieve with a [Kalgas Set](../other/starter-dungeons/kalgas-cave.html). In this dungeon, you can obtain your first set of Shiny Equipment and also earn coins that you can use to purchase items from the NPC outside the dungeon to upgrade your equipment.
One of the benefits of completing Les Britannia is that endgame players can still obtain useful items here. With the Shiny Items, you can increase your

Magma Cave.description:
Magma Cave is one of the essential dungeons on this server. It requires Black Armor equipment to obtain [Soulreaver](../../soulreaver.html)equipment and, subsequently, access to [Royal content](../../royal.html). To successfully complete this dungeon, players must have **1.700.000 HP** and a moderate damage output. The dungeon consists of five mini-bosses and one final boss.
Aside from Black Armor parts, players can also acquire Blood Orbs, which are essential for Armor Merges that can be exchanged in [Kebaria](../kebaria.html). It is recommended to have a [Tank](../../../balance/self-sustain-tank.html), AoE class, and 1o1 class for this dungeon, as there are numerous smaller monsters and six formidable ones that may take some time to defeat.
[You can see the map of Magma Cave here.](../../../../files.gitbook.com/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces/b31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu/uploads/nHkWXAqbNUpuVux30L2E/MagmaMapebe4.png?alt=media&token=4f41b7f4-402d-40f3-af3d-ce9c739a1dfe)

Aurania.description:
Aurania is one of our custom content zones with daily quests. You can see and auto-accept every quest of this continent with the blackboard, which is just a few steps apart from the spawn. Every quest is visible in your quest tab (Q). The quests of Aurania contain normal monster quests, collection quests, boss Aurania is a zone that offers daily quests as part of our custom content.
In Aurania, players can farm everything they need to upgrade their weapons to Black Shiny and upgrade their [Ruby](aurania/dark-forest.html), [Sapphire](../../systems/dungeon-ranking-rewards/underwater-world.html), [Emerald](aurania/mystic-valley.html), and [Topaz](aurania/crystal-cave.html)Jewelry to Aura Jewelry. It's important to note that to successfully complete the quests in Aurania, players need to have a team with equipped Shiny characters. Additionally, players must have a minimum of 900,000 HP and a strong base damage, which can be achieved with [Shiny equipment](../shiny.html).
For beginners, we recommend a tank class and a 1o1 class for bosses. Completing quests in Aurania provides many benefits, including the opportunity to obtain EXP for players above Platinum 50. The quests in Aurania are an excellent way to upgrade your equipment and advance your character's level, so be sure to take advantage of them every dailyquests and some Dungeon quests. Here you can farm everything to upgrade your Weapon to Black Shiny and the [Ruby](aurania/dark-forest.html), [Sapphire](../../systems/dungeon-ranking-rewards/underwater-world.html), [Emerald](aurania/mystic-valley.html)and [Topaz](aurania/crystal-cave.html)Jewelry to Aura Jewelry! If you are over Platinum 50, you will receive EXP for completing the quests.

How to upgrade your jewelry.description:
You have to upgrade the [Ruby](dark-forest.html)/[Sapphire](../../../systems/dungeon-ranking-rewards/underwater-world.html)/[Emerald](mystic-valley.html)/[Topaz](crystal-cave.html)Jewelry to obtain the Aura jewelry.
If you want to Uprade your Jewelry you need:
* 28x Kings heart
* 80x Magic Stones from the Aurania Dungeons
* 8000 orbs.
Note: You get the orbs from every monster inside the dungeon and the boss drops 1-3 Magic Stones (depends on your luckybox).
* [Dark Forest](dark-forest.html)is for Ruby.
* [Underwater World](../../../systems/dungeon-ranking-rewards/underwater-world.html)is for Sapphire.
* [Mystic Valley](mystic-valley.html)is for Emerald.
* [Crystal Cave](crystal-cave.html)is for Topaz.
If you have all needed items go to **[Dungeon Exchanger] Lucy** in Aurania and Exhange your Old Jewelry for the Aura Jewelry!

Aurania Temple.description:
The Aurania Temple is the main dungeon in Aurania, and it is where you can obtain the most critical part for Black Weapons. The end boss in this dungeon drops [Black Weapon Materials](aurania-temple.html) that you can use to create weapons boxes in Aurania. To successfully complete this dungeon, you will need a team with equipped Shiny characters. You will need to have **1.800.000 HP** and a strong damage output. A [Tank with Suck Blood](../../../balance/self-sustain-tank.html), an AoE class, and a 1o1 class are the perfect team for this dungeon.
The monsters in the Aurania Temple are challenging, and you will need to have a solid strategy to overcome them. The dungeon is not easy, and it requires a coordinated team effort. As you progress through the dungeon, you will encounter several mini-bosses before facing the end boss. It is crucial to defeat these mini-bosses to progress through the dungeon.
[The Black Weapon Materials](aurania-temple.html) dropped by the end boss are crucial to obtaining Black Weapons. These weapons are among the most powerful in the game, and they are highly sought after by players. Additionally, the coins earned from this dungeon can be used to purchase valuable items such as upgrade stones and potions.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FoUeFlap2tVbuBivKVtdm%252Fauranai%2520temple.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db0bf5180-e388-40b7-8b21-4865473cd932&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=fa2f09e8&sv=2

Dark Forest.description:
The Dark Forest is one of the four [jewelry dungeons](../../../qol-changes/partyfinder/how-to-use-the-partyfinder.html) in Aurania. To conquer this dungeon, you will need **900.000 HP**, and a Shiny Damage should suffice. For beginners, it is recommended to have a tank and a 1o1 class for the bosses.
The Dark Forest is where you can obtain everything you need to upgrade your jewelry set into an Aura Jewelry set. In this dungeon, you can collect all the materials necessary for the Ruby Jewelry set (STR).
To obtain the materials for the Ruby Jewelry set, you will have to battle through a range of monsters and bosses, each with their unique abilities and strengths. But with the right strategy and equipment, you can overcome them and obtain the valuable materials needed to upgrade your jewelry.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FHFgT1phxwDAK04MoYL8g%252Fdarkforest.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D372141a9-b389-43ba-828e-c38f921b4e8e&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=e832fcac&sv=2

Mystic Valley.description:
Mystic Valley is one of the four [jewelry dungeons](how-to-upgrade-your-jewelry.html) in Aurania. To successfully complete this dungeon, you will need to have **900.000 HP**, and a shiny damage is sufficient to overcome the challenges. For beginners, it is recommended to have a tank and a 1o1 class for the bosses.
In this dungeon, you can obtain everything you need to upgrade your jewelry set to an Aura jewelry set. Specifically, in Mystic Valley, you can acquire all the items required for the Emerald jewelry set (DEX). These items can be used to create and upgrade your jewelry, providing you with significant boosts to your character's stats.
Mystic Valley can be challenging, but it is a great place to grind for jewelry materials, especially if you are aiming to create or upgrade your Aura jewelry set. Additionally, the dungeon provides a chance to earn valuable rewards, including rare items and coins that can be used to purchase other items.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FxaWaZU6FIFsOTfVFzQDP%252FMystic%2520Valley.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0745ddf1-0f5d-47bb-9f7a-0e8ed6542912&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=38cb1a33&sv=2

Underwater World.description:
Underwater World is one of the four [jewelry dungeons](../../../qol-changes/partyfinder/how-to-use-the-partyfinder.html) located in Aurania. To successfully complete this dungeon, you will need to have **900.000 HP**, which can be achieved with Shiny Damage equipment. For beginners, it is recommended to have a [Tank](../../../balance/self-sustain-tank.html) class and a 1o1 class for taking down the bosses.
Completing Underwater World is essential for upgrading your jewelry set to the Aura Jewelry Set. In this dungeon, you can obtain all the materials needed to upgrade your jewelry to the Sapphire set (INT). This set is ideal for players who rely on intelligence-based skills.
The Underwater World is challenging, but with the right equipment and skills, you can successfully navigate through it. There are multiple boss fights in this dungeon, and each one requires a different strategy to defeat. A team with well-equipped Shiny characters is necessary for completing this dungeon.
The rewards for completing Underwater World are significant. In addition to obtaining the necessary materials to upgrade your jewelry set, you can also earn valuable items such as upgrade stones and potions. It is worth noting that some of the items obtained in this dungeon can only be obtained here, making it a must-do for any serious Aurania player.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FxqdK8nEVgttCCFUDDKtB%252Funderwaterworld.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D9df3e00a-9ea9-421e-a77c-ff59b3a16790&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=b3ce2f7b&sv=2

Crystal Cave.description:
Crystal Cave is one of the four [jewelry dungeons](../../../qol-changes/partyfinder/how-to-use-the-partyfinder.html) located in Aurania. To successfully complete this dungeon, you will need **900.000 HP**, and a solid Shiny damage output should suffice. For beginners, it is recommended to have a Tank class and a 1o1 class for the bosses.
This dungeon is unique in that it provides all the necessary materials to upgrade your jewelry set to an Aura jewelry set. In Crystal Cave, you can obtain all the necessary items for the Topaz jewelry set, which is focused on improving your stamina.
While completing the dungeon, you will encounter various enemies, including bosses, that will challenge your skills and teamwork. With the right equipment and strategy, you can overcome the challenges and reap the rewards.
In addition to upgrading your jewelry set, the items obtained in Crystal Cave can also be sold to other players or used for crafting. This makes it a popular dungeon for players looking to improve their gear and wealth.

The Trigrem Ruins is one of the three Soulreaver dungeons and the precursor to the [Royal Equipment](../../royal.html). In this dungeon, you can obtain Soulreaver Set parts, which must be merged with [Black Equipment](../../black.html) later on.
To enter this dungeon, you must have**3.000.000 HP** and a solid damage output. Additionally, having a [tank with Suck Blood](../../../balance/self-sustain-tank.html) and a solid 1v1 damage dealer will make clearing the dungeon much easier.
The Trigrem Ruins is a challenging dungeon that requires teamwork and a strong strategy. The rewards, however, are worth the effort, as the Soulreaver Set parts can be merged with [Black Equipment](../../black.html) to create powerful equipment that can help in your battles. Ethral Garden.description:
The Ethral Garden is the weapon dungeon in the Soulreaver content and is noticeably shorter than Trigrem Ruins, but also slightly more difficult. To enter this dungeon, you must have **3.700.000 HP**and a strong damage output.
Similar to [Trigrem Ruins](../trigrem/trigrem-ruins.html), having a character with AoE damage is desirable, as well as a [tank with Suck Blood](../../../balance/self-sustain-tank.html) and a strong 1v1 damage dealer. The end boss in this dungeon drops Soulreaver Relics, which can be exchanged for a weapon box in [Ethral](../ethral.html). With a bit of luck, you can obtain a powerful weapon from the box.
In addition to the Relics, you can also obtain items that can be used to enhance your future weapons. These items can be used to increase the stats of your weapons or add additional effects to them.
[You can see the map of Ethral Garden here.](../../../../files.gitbook.com/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces/b31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu/uploads/8X4kCI0EnOQ3VQDOIaTL/EthralGardenMap312a.png?alt=media&token=eb39cb31-815b-46b7-82d1-35ebd66400af)

Deep Temple.description:
The Deep Temple is the most challenging dungeon in the Soulreaver area. Unlike the other two dungeons, there are very few monsters in this dungeon, but they are incredibly strong. The dungeon has two minibosses and an end boss, and to spawn the end boss, you must kill 75 monsters in the dungeon.
To succeed in this dungeon, you will need a [tank with Suck Blood](../../balance/self-sustain-tank.html) and a strong 1v1 damage dealer. AoE damage is not necessary here. The Deep Temple is also the first dungeon with patterns, which requires you to have a high level of skill and precision to succeed.
To enter the Deep Temple, you must have **3.500.000 HP** and a very high damage output. This dungeon is not for the faint of heart and requires careful planning, strategy, and teamwork to defeat the bosses.

What is Cardia?.description:
Cardia is a hidden island at the edge of Madrigal, which is bigger than Saint Morning or even Darkon and has many resources for the production of items and remedies like rare plants, crystals or minerals.
The island has not been fully explored by all the inhabitants yet, maybe you will find out more.
It is the favorite island of scholars and wise people who moved to Cardia to learn everything about the island.
The island was not too long ago a place for the peaceful inhabitants of Madrigal before the chaos broke out on the island. Some people strong mages, blacksmiths, professors, scientists, adventurers, treasure hunters, miners and soldiers stayed on the island after the incident on Cardia, because they don't want to give up the place and finally all Madrigal would be in danger!
[img]../../../index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.entropia.fun%2Fimages%2Fthumb%2F9%2F9b%2FXsdffD.png%2F500px-XsdffD.png&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=db2b1022&sv=2
In Cardia you can expect a lot of content such as a**longer story quest**, **group quests**, **daily quests**, **daily group boss monsters**, **treasures**,
**resources**, **secrets**and **puzzles**, which must be solved!

There are also two group dungeons on this island.

The **prerequisites**for Cardia are that you have at **least one Soulreaver set & weapon**, which is strongly upgraded, because the monsters and creatures suffer absolutely no damage with other weapons! The Soulreaver Items probably have a special power...
In Cardia you can expect a **story quest (one-time)**, some **one-time hunt quests**, which can be done **alone**or as a **group**and **daily quests** of which you always get **10 random ones every day** and should be done quickly.
___
###

Destruction Cavern.description:
The Destruction Cavern is the toughest dungeon on the server, located on the Cardia Map, and accessible only to players with Royal Level 10. It is known for dropping a plethora of items, mainly Royal Equipment and upgrade items.
The dungeon consists of eight minibosses and a final boss, each requiring up to 5.3 million HP to defeat. Due to the intense level of difficulty, players need a strong tank, preferably one with damage absorb capabilities since the damage dealt is extremely high and must be healed. Hybrid tanks are not recommended, as Suckblood is capped at 7,5%. Unless they are significantly well-equipped, they might not be strong enough to handle the dungeon's challenges.
In addition to a sturdy tank, high damage output is also crucial. A minimum requirement for players is to have a perfect SR EQ, but Royal Darkness Equipment is highly recommended for best results. This equipment provides players with the highest damage output and increases their chances of survival in the dungeon.
Overall, the Destruction Cavern presents a unique and challenging experience for players who are looking for a test of their skills and equipment. However, it is not for the faint-hearted, and players must prepare adequately before attempting to enter the dungeon.

Heroic Destrucion Cavern.description:
The Destruction Cavern Dungeon features a Heroic Mode, designed for very strong endgame players and can only be accessed at Royal Level 20.
In this mode, you will receive a Drop+2 buff in the dungeon and some buffs that bring negative effects to your character.
The dungeon includes a timerun where you can obtain a Heroic Destruction Treasure and a Fire Flower (Binded).
The Heroic Treasure contains useful items such as new [shader weapons](../../../../others/fashion-shader.html), [suit glows](../../../../others/weapon-and-set-glow.html), [hand glows](../../../../others/weapon-and-set-glow.html), [weapon glows](../../../../others/weapon-and-set-glow.html), and many other useful items. Azmore Forest.description:
The Azmore Forest, much like the Destruction Cavern, is located in Cardia. It serves as an endgame dungeon where players can acquire a plethora of useful items, primarily Royal Set pieces and items for upgrading them.
To successfully traverse the Azmore Forest, players will need to have at least 5,000,000 HP and deal massive amounts of damage. While SR EQ (equipment) may suffice, it is highly recommended to have a set of Royal EQ.
In addition, it is crucial to have a well-equipped tank as the dungeon features a 5% Blood Suck Cap. This means that the tank will need to absorb a significant amount of damage to keep the rest of the party alive.
Overall, the Azmore Forest is a challenging but rewarding dungeon that requires players to have a high level of skill and equipment to conquer.

Amethyst Forest.description:
Once you reach Royal Level 10, there are five additional levels to achieve. Upon reaching Royal Level 15, you can melt down your Soulreaver equipment and unlock the Trance Mode. Additionally, you will receive three stats per level beyond Royal Level 10.
To level up after reaching Royal Level 10, you can participate in Daily Quests or level up in the Amethyst Forest, which can be accessed at Royal Level 10. The monsters in this map can deal up to 1.2 million damage, so it's essential to have solid Royal equipment in order to defeat them.
It's important to note that leveling up after Royal Level 10 requires more effort and dedication, as the challenges become increasingly difficult. However, the rewards are also greater, and the Trance Mode can be a valuable asset for battle. Be sure to continuously upgrade your equipment and stats to keep up with the challenges and make the most of your Royal Level progression.

What is the Dread Cove Isle?.description:
In the uncharted waters near Cardia, an island rose from the sea that had not been seen for thousands of years: **Dread Cove Isle**. Shrouded in dense fog, it hid from the world, letting only rumors of its existence seep through to the neighboring ports.
Pirates, attracted by the lure of immense wealth, were drawn to these rumors. Ships filled with rough and rugged seamen set off to discover the island and plunder its treasures. All returned with tales of strange occurrences and mysterious phenomena.
The island itself was a bizarre landscape, dominated by a dense, impenetrable jungle called Umbala and crisscrossed by expansive caves overrun by pirates. The trees in the Umbala jungle seemed to whisper and move as if they were alive, emanating an aura of magic and mystery that kept all intruders at bay.
The cave, deep beneath the surface of Dread Cove Isle, was a labyrinth of dark passages and rooms. Pirates discovered ancient, saltwater-etched writings on the walls and found chests full of gold and jewels. But with each treasure they lifted from the depths of the cave, they seemed to awaken an even deeper darkness.
It was as if the island was resisting its plunderers. The fog grew denser and eerier. The trees in the Umbala jungle seemed even more threatening and the whispering grew louder. Eventually, entire pirate ships disappeared after leaving the island, never reaching their home ports.
Despite these warnings and mysterious incidents, the wealth hidden on Dread Cove Isle could not deter the pirates. They kept returning, drawn by the prospect of treasures and the mystery surrounding the island.
Thus, Dread Cove Isle remains an island of mystery and danger to this day, its treasures and terrors sought alike by greedy pirates. It is a world full of mysteries and wonders, hidden in a fog of oblivion and legends. Those who dare to uncover its secrets must be prepared to face the consequences that come with the treasures of Dread Cove Isle.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FgLaNanIvEb0V9NYy5wOD%252Fs2WaAwC%2520-%2520Imgur.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D1416b9a3-31d6-4140-8c8f-2d4a99c8e223&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=cb71aec9&sv=2

Pirate Cave.description:
The **Pirate Cave** is a tough dungeon located on [**Dread Cove Isle**](../dread-cove-isle.html). It is accessible to players with [**Royal Level 15**](../../royal-level-10-15.html) and higher. In the Pirate Cave, you can obtain **Fashion Upgrade Items** for your Omega Fashion as well as **Jewelry Upgrade Materials**. To defeat the end boss, you will need **6,700,000 HP**. Achieving this requires a very strong **tank** and high **1v1 damage** to defeat the bosses. Additionally, **AoE (Area of Effect)** damage is crucial to eliminate the trash mobs.
In addition to a sturdy tank, high **damage output** is essential. A [**Royal EQ**](../../../../sets-weapons-and-items/royal-equipment.html) is the minimum requirement for players, as this equipment provides the highest possible damage output and significantly increases your chances of survival in the dungeon.
Overall, the Pirate Cave offers a unique and challenging experience for players who are looking to test their skills and equipment. However, it is not for the faint-hearted, and players must prepare thoroughly before attempting to enter the dungeon.

Umbala.description:
Umbala is a challenging dungeon located on [Dread Cove Isle](../dread-cove-isle.html). It is accessible to players starting from [Royal Level 15](../../royal-level-15-20.html). In the Umbala dungeon, you can obtain items for exchanging for Umbala furniture. To defeat the final boss, you need 6,700,000 HP. To reach this HP threshold, you'll need a very strong tank and high 1-on-1 damage to defeat the bosses. Additionally, AoE (Area of Effect) damage is crucial for clearing the trash mobs.
Along with a sturdy tank, high damage output is also essential. A [Royal Equipmen](../../../../sets-weapons-and-items/royal-equipment.html)[t](../../../../sets-weapons-and-items/royal-equipment.html)set is the minimum requirement for players, as this equipment provides the highest damage output and significantly increases your chances of survival in the dungeon.
Overall, Umbala offers a unique and demanding challenge for players looking to test their skills and equipment. However, it is not for the faint of heart, and players must prepare thoroughly before entering the dungeon.

üìâ PvE Balance.description:
There are various classes that players can choose from. Each class has its own strengths, weaknesses, and abilities that it can utilize in combat.
On the following pages, you will find a brief explanation and description of each class, allowing you to make an informed decision about which class best suits your preferences. Each class has its own unique strengths and weaknesses, and understanding these characteristics can help you determine which class is the best fit for your playstyle.

Current PvE Meta.description:
1. Slayer
2. Harlequin
3. Mentalist
4. Force master
5. Crackshooter
6. Arcanist
7. Templar/Seraph

ü™ì Slayer.description:
The Slayer is widely considered to be the class with the highest 1v1 damage output in most MMORPGs. This is because the Slayer's kit is designed to excel in single target combat. Unlike other classes that may have more versatile kits or better AoE damage, the Slayer is focused solely on dealing as much damage as possible to a single target.
However, this focus on 1v1 damage comes at a cost. The Slayer has very little AoE damage potential, which makes it difficult for them to take on groups of enemies or clear out large areas quickly. Additionally, the Slayer has low, making them more vulnerable to attacks.
Furthermore, the Slayer lacks a support kit, which means they are not able to heal or buff allies like other classes such as Priests or Paladins. And while the Slayer can still contribute to group play with their high single target damage, their lack of support abilities can make them less desirable for group content.
Another weakness of the Slayer is their farming potential, which is quite low compared to other classes. This is due to the Slayer's focus on single target damage, which makes it difficult for them to farm large groups of enemies efficiently.
Despite these weaknesses, the Slayer's high 1v1 damage output makes them a formidable opponent in PvP and boss fights. However, their hybrid build can tax their damage output, pushing them down to a lower tier of DPS compared to other classes. As a result, Slayers are often placed in the front line of battles, relying on their high damage output to take down enemies quickly before they have a chance to strike back.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252Fmr5WPX8Xoex0PlilNO9v%252FSlayer.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D07153d56-89c4-4ba7-b62b-82bcca06ac5d&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=a9122d46&sv=2

üÉè Harlequin.description:
The Harlequin is known to have the second highest 1v1 damage output. Similar to the Slayer, the Harlequin lacks good AoE damage and a support kit, but they do not have as low HP as the Slayer. This makes them a decent option for soloing low-tier dungeons, as they have enough HP to withstand enemy attacks while dealing high damage output.
However, just like the Slayer, the Harlequin has little farming potential due to their focus on single target damage. They are not as efficient at clearing out large groups of enemies quickly, which can make it difficult to farm resources and complete quests.
Because of their slightly higher HP compared to the Slayer, the Harlequin is able to maintain good survivability while dealing a high amount of damage in 1v1 combat. However, their damage output is slightly lower than that of the Slayer, which is a tradeoff for their improved survivability.
Overall, the Harlequin is a strong option for players who enjoy dealing high amounts of single target damage and have a preference for solo content. Their ability to survive in combat, combined with their high damage output, makes them a good choice for taking on bosses and other powerful enemies. However, in group content where support and AoE damage are important, the Harlequin may not be the best fit.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252F8YZFgzVjPv2bfOcYrUZw%252Fharlequin.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5031eff0-9fca-49cf-a04f-7fb501d7fcb7&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=becde1d7&sv=2

Mentalist.description:
The Mentalist is a class that is known to have the third highest 1v1 damage output. The Mentalist has a decent AoE damage output and a fine 1v1 damage, but not much more beyond that. They have a low base HP and lack a support kit or other skills that can assist the group.
While the Mentalist may have a disadvantage in 1v1 combat against classes like the Slayer and Harlequin, they make up for it with their ability to apply debuffs to bosses. This can be a significant advantage in group content, where debuffing the boss can help the group deal more damage and increase their chances of success.
However, due to their focus on AoE damage, the Mentalist has lower damage output compared to the Slayer and Harlequin. They are not as efficient at dealing high amounts of single target damage, which can make it difficult to take on powerful enemies in 1v1 combat.
Overall, the Mentalist is a great option for players who enjoy dealing AoE damage and providing debuffs in group content. They may not be the best fit for players who prefer solo content or who want to deal high amounts of single target damage. However, in group content where support and debuffs are important, the Mentalist can be a valuable asset to the team.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FlIIsFwRiwPTfkVa0a993%252FMentalist.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D389050f6-c762-4c09-aca0-d26e9b03213e&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=eb8cdfa6&sv=2

ü•ä Force Master.description:
The Force Master has been recognized for possessing the fourth highest 1v1 Damage among all the classes. However, one might ask, why is this the case? To begin with, the Force Master is regarded as the second best Tank Class due to his impressive base HP, which sets him apart from his peers. Additionally, his AoE capabilities are relatively decent, and his 1v1 Damage output is not too shabby either.
Despite his prowess in multiple areas, the Force Master's overall gameplay style is that of a Hybrid. Consequently, it is expected that his 1v1 Damage output should not be excessively high. This is where his unique debuff comes into play, which helps to mitigate any minimal lack of damage that may be encountered during combat. Overall, the Force Master is a versatile class that boasts an array of impressive abilities and attributes, making him a formidable opponent in both group and individual fights.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FoQEWQx2QQwwrhAqRxBAY%252FForce%2520Master.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D610af929-29bf-4b94-ab94-057793ec41f7&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=3b90c6c9&sv=2

üèπ Crackshooter.description:
The Crackshooter is a class that typically has the fifth highest 1v1 damage. However, the Crackshooter's strengths extend beyond just damage output.
One of the key advantages of the Crackshooter is their Entropia Movement skill, which allows them to cut through attacks or shoot through walls. This ability makes them very effective at farming and exploring, allowing them to reach areas that other classes might not be able to access.
In addition to their movement abilities, the Crackshooter also has a decent base block chance and respectable AoE damage output. These abilities make them effective in combat as well, allowing them to take on groups of enemies and deal damage while avoiding attacks.
Because of their strong farming potential and versatility in combat, the Crackshooter's 1v1 damage output is slightly lower than other classes like the Slayer and Harlequin. This is a deliberate balancing decision, as the Crackshooter's other strengths make them a valuable asset in a variety of situations.
Overall, the Crackshooter is a class that offers a unique mix of movement, farming, and combat abilities. While their 1v1 damage output may not be as high as other classes, their versatility and flexibility make them a valuable addition to any group.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FcfbCrCPSv1LjwXAIEZUV%252FCrackshooter.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da8361bb9-14a9-4ed0-bebe-013113ad40ca&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=7e2d67f9&sv=2

Arcanist.description:
The Arcanist is known for his exceptional ability to deal massive amounts of damage to multiple targets at once, thanks to his powerful AoE spells. His primary strength lies in his ability to obliterate large groups of enemies with ease, making him a sought-after asset in group settings. However, when it comes to 1v1 combat, the Arcanist's damage output is not as impressive as some of the other classes, which might lead some players to overlook him in favor of other options.
Despite this, we believe that ranking the Arcanist too low on the list would be a disservice to his unique strengths. His unparalleled AoE damage output more than justifies his position on the list, even if his 1v1 damage is not as high as some of the other classes. To balance out this discrepancy, we decided to upgrade his Bubble Damage, making him more effective in both PvE and PvP combat.
By upgrading the Arcanist's Bubble Damage, we hope to make him a more viable option for players who prefer a more well-rounded character. This upgrade will enable him to deal more damage to single targets, while still retaining his impressive AoE capabilities. In summary, while the Arcanist's 1v1 damage may not be as strong as some of the other classes, his exceptional AoE damage and well-rounded kit make him a valuable asset in any group setting.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FvXV8Nxpe3A1rgn3vVDqg%252FArcanist.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddc77daa2-6cd9-41fe-bc91-ba57c9c1a5ab&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=bab5a48&sv=2

üõ° Templar.description:
The Templar is a class in Entropia that is primarily designed for tanking and supporting roles. As such, his kit is not primarily focused on dealing high damage output, which is why he is ranked seventh in terms of 1v1 damage. While the Templar does have decent 1v1 damage, it is not as strong as some of the other classes higher on the list.
Moreover, the Templar's AoE damage is lacking when compared to some of the other classes. However, the Templar's main strength lies in his tanking abilities and his ability to sustain himself in combat. His high base HP, strong armor, and various self-healing abilities make him a formidable tank and a valuable asset to any team, especially in dungeons where survivability is crucial.
In summary, while the Templar may not have the highest damage output, his well-rounded kit and strong tanking abilities justify his placement as the 7th class in terms of 1v1 damage. He may not be the most flashy or damaging class, but his ability to take hits and keep himself and his team alive make him a valuable addition to any group.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FRw0kOWIuammcWqkcUfXW%252Ftemplar.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4ce5dc22-f644-4741-80b6-644d4b352382&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=76cd00d&sv=2

üëº Seraph.description:
The Seraph is a unique class in that it offers a perfect mix between every class in Entropia. While it is not a full supporter like some other classes, it has a support kit and is playable as 1v1.
One of the standout features of the Seraph is its very good AoE damage, which makes it a valuable asset in party situations where large groups of enemies need to be taken down quickly. Additionally, the Seraph has a decent HP EQ, which allows it to hold its own in combat.
But what really sets the Seraph apart is its versatility. It can perform well in a variety of roles, from dealing damage in 1v1 situations to providing support to the rest of the party. This makes it a valuable addition to any group, and a strong choice for players who want to be able to handle any situation that comes their way.
While the Seraph's 1v1 damage is not as high as some of the other classes on this list, its versatility and ability to adapt to different situations more than make up for it. Overall, the Seraph is a well-rounded and valuable class that can hold its own in a variety of situations.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FGszxz3aIl6vsHC3fJV1M%252FSeraph.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dc2a45434-f616-4099-a337-c767a3579788&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=8558c5a&sv=2

üõ° Self Sustain Tank.description:
A Self Sustain Tank is a class that is capable of absorbing large amounts of damage while also healing themselves due to their high survivability. To build such a tank, it is important to focus on the right equipment, abilities, and attributes.
Firstly, the tank needs to have high endurance to withstand as much damage as possible. Therefore, all attributes that increase endurance should be maximized. It is also important for the tank to have enough strength to occasionally deal damage and draw the opponent's attention. Thus, the character's strength should also be increased.
In terms of equipment, it is crucial for the tank to have high defense to absorb damage. A good armor and shield are essential for this. It is also important for the tank to have a weapon that supports their self-healing abilities. A weapon with life-regeneration stats or one that enables healing is a good choice.
Finally, optimizing the tank's abilities is essential to increase their survivability. Abilities that reduce damage or heal are particularly important here. Some abilities that improve the tank's health can also be useful. It is also important to prepare the tank for the use of potions and buffs to quickly respond to difficult battles.
In summary, building a Self Sustain Tank requires a strong combination of endurance, defense, strength, self-healing, and tactical gameplay. With the right equipment, abilities, and strategy, a Self Sustain Tank can be a valuable addition to any group.
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FokB3Kmgmdm95BOflKkJX%252FSelfsustaintank.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D682528e6-10c2-46a0-ac30-d118182d80c9&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=fcbe613e&sv=2

üåü Weapon and Set Glow.description:
[img]https://wiki.entropia.top/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2400962713-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252Fb31Yp1jJXF9fFE5753Pu%252Fuploads%252FU95UEdYrXUtyXMDkgwzR%252FAu08tkW-ezgif.com-video-to-gif-converter.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D70f138b5-f0d9-477f-a947-8e868f7a5237&width=400&dpr=1&quality=100&sign=dfab4d11&sv=2
Through the Heroic Deep Temple, Destruction Cavern, and Azmore Forest Timerun, you can obtain glowstones. These glowstones can be inserted into the Element Change window and overwrite the glow of the respective element.
The glowstones retain their effect for a certain period of time. If you remove them by double-clicking on them in the Element Change window, the glowstones are completely destroyed.
There are eight different types of glowstones.
Accordingly, we have created 80 new weapon glows and added them to all weapon types.
These glowstone items can be traded.
The weapon glows can be viewed in the Item Wiki Model Viewer by equipping the corresponding weapon beforehand and then pressing on the corresponding glowstone.

Additionally, we have also introduced approximately 40 new suit glows and hand glows. These can be activated as item buffs for a certain period of time and overwrite your current suit and hand glow.
These glows can only be obtained through the Timerun in the Heroic Deep Temple, Destruction Cavern, and Azmore Forest.
These items can also be traded.
You can view these glows in the Item Wiki Model Viewer by selecting an item as a model beforehand.
